00540 static inline uint64_t CVMX_DPI_SLI_PRTX_CFG(unsigned long offset)
00541 {
00542     if (!(
00543           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN61XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00544           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN63XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00545           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN66XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00546           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00547           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset <= 2))) ||
00548           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00549           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00550           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00551           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF71XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00552           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 3)))))
00553         cvmx_warn("CVMX_DPI_SLI_PRTX_CFG(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
00554     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000900ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 8;
00555 }
00556 #else

00558 #endif
00559 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00560 static inline uint64_t CVMX_DPI_SLI_PRTX_ERR(unsigned long offset)
00561 {
00562     switch(cvmx_get_octeon_family()) {
00563         case OCTEON_CNF75XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00564         case OCTEON_CN66XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00565         case OCTEON_CN73XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00566         case OCTEON_CN78XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00567             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
00568                 if ((offset <= 3))
00569                     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000920ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 8;
00570             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X))
00571                 if ((offset <= 3))
00572                     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000920ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 8;
00573             if ((offset <= 3))
00574                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000920ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 8;
00575             break;
00576         case OCTEON_CNF71XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00577         case OCTEON_CN61XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00578         case OCTEON_CN68XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00579 
00580             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX_PASS1))
00581                 if ((offset <= 1))
00582                     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000928ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 8;
00583 
00584             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX_PASS2))
00585                 if ((offset <= 1))
00586                     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000920ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 8;
00587             if ((offset <= 1))
00588                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000920ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 8;
00589             break;
00590         case OCTEON_CN70XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00591             if ((offset <= 2))
00592                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000920ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 8;
00593             break;
00594         case OCTEON_CN63XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00595             if ((offset <= 1))
00596                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000928ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 8;
00597             break;
00598     }
00599     cvmx_warn("CVMX_DPI_SLI_PRTX_ERR (offset = %lu) not supported on this chip\n", offset);
00600     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000920ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 8;
00601 }
00602 #else
00603 static inline uint64_t CVMX_DPI_SLI_PRTX_ERR(unsigned long offset)
00604 {
00605     switch(cvmx_get_octeon_family()) {
00606         case OCTEON_CNF75XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00607         case OCTEON_CN66XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00608         case OCTEON_CN73XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00609         case OCTEON_CN78XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00610             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
00611                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000920ull) + (offset) * 8;
00612             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X))
00613                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000920ull) + (offset) * 8;
00614             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000920ull) + (offset) * 8;
00615         case OCTEON_CNF71XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00616         case OCTEON_CN61XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00617         case OCTEON_CN68XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00618 
00619             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX_PASS1))
00620                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000928ull) + (offset) * 8;
00621 
00622             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX_PASS2))
00623                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000920ull) + (offset) * 8;
00624             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000920ull) + (offset) * 8;
00625         case OCTEON_CN70XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00626             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000920ull) + (offset) * 8;
00627         case OCTEON_CN63XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00628             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000928ull) + (offset) * 8;
00629     }
00630     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000920ull) + (offset) * 8;
00631 }
00632 #endif
00633 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00634 static inline uint64_t CVMX_DPI_SLI_PRTX_ERR_INFO(unsigned long offset)
00635 {
00636     if (!(
00637           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN61XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00638           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN63XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00639           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN66XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00640           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00641           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset <= 2))) ||
00642           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00643           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00644           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00645           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF71XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00646           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 3)))))
00647         cvmx_warn("CVMX_DPI_SLI_PRTX_ERR_INFO(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
00648     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000940ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 8;
00649 }
00650 #else
00651 #define CVMX_DPI_SLI_PRTX_ERR_INFO(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000940ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 8)
00652 #endif
00653 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00654 static inline uint64_t CVMX_DPI_SRIO_RX_BELLX(unsigned long offset)
00655 {
00656     if (!(
00657           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 31)))))
00658         cvmx_warn("CVMX_DPI_SRIO_RX_BELLX(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
00659     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000080200ull) + ((offset) & 31) * 8;
00660 }
00661 #else
00662 #define CVMX_DPI_SRIO_RX_BELLX(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000080200ull) + ((offset) & 31) * 8)
00663 #endif
00664 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00665 static inline uint64_t CVMX_DPI_SRIO_RX_BELL_SEQX(unsigned long offset)
00666 {
00667     if (!(
00668           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 31)))))
00669         cvmx_warn("CVMX_DPI_SRIO_RX_BELL_SEQX(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
00670     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000080400ull) + ((offset) & 31) * 8;
00671 }
00672 #else
00673 #define CVMX_DPI_SRIO_RX_BELL_SEQX(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000080400ull) + ((offset) & 31) * 8)
00674 #endif
00675 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00676 #define CVMX_DPI_SWA_Q_VMID CVMX_DPI_SWA_Q_VMID_FUNC()
00677 static inline uint64_t CVMX_DPI_SWA_Q_VMID_FUNC(void)
00678 {
00679     if (!(OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX)))
00680         cvmx_warn("CVMX_DPI_SWA_Q_VMID not supported on this chip\n");
00681     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000030ull);
00682 }
00683 #else
00684 #define CVMX_DPI_SWA_Q_VMID (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001DF0000000030ull))
00685 #endif

00687 /**
00688  * cvmx_dpi_bist_status
00689  *
00690  * This is the built-in self-test (BIST) status register. Each bit is the BIST result of an
00691  * individual memory (per bit, 0 = pass and 1 = fail).
00692  */
00693 union cvmx_dpi_bist_status {
00694     uint64_t u64;
00695     struct cvmx_dpi_bist_status_s {
00696 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00697     uint64_t reserved_57_63               : 7;
00698     uint64_t bist                         : 57; /**< BIST results. Hardware sets a bit in BIST for memory that fails. */
00699 #else
00700     uint64_t bist                         : 57;
00701     uint64_t reserved_57_63               : 7;
00702 #endif
00703     } s;
00704     struct cvmx_dpi_bist_status_cn61xx {
00705 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00706     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
00707     uint64_t bist                         : 47; /**< BIST Results.
00708                                                          HW sets a bit in BIST for for memory that fails
00709                                                          BIST. */
00710 #else
00711     uint64_t bist                         : 47;
00712     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
00713 #endif
00714     } cn61xx;
00715     struct cvmx_dpi_bist_status_cn63xx {
00716 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00717     uint64_t reserved_45_63               : 19;
00718     uint64_t bist                         : 45; /**< BIST Results.
00719                                                          HW sets a bit in BIST for for memory that fails
00720                                                          BIST. */
00721 #else
00722     uint64_t bist                         : 45;
00723     uint64_t reserved_45_63               : 19;
00724 #endif
00725     } cn63xx;
00726     struct cvmx_dpi_bist_status_cn63xxp1 {
00727 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00728     uint64_t reserved_37_63               : 27;
00729     uint64_t bist                         : 37; /**< BIST Results.
00730                                                          HW sets a bit in BIST for for memory that fails
00731                                                          BIST. */
00732 #else
00733     uint64_t bist                         : 37;
00734     uint64_t reserved_37_63               : 27;
00735 #endif
00736     } cn63xxp1;
00737     struct cvmx_dpi_bist_status_cn61xx    cn66xx;
00738     struct cvmx_dpi_bist_status_cn63xx    cn68xx;
00739     struct cvmx_dpi_bist_status_cn63xx    cn68xxp1;
00740     struct cvmx_dpi_bist_status_cn61xx    cn70xx;
00741     struct cvmx_dpi_bist_status_cn61xx    cn70xxp1;
00742     struct cvmx_dpi_bist_status_s         cn73xx;
00743     struct cvmx_dpi_bist_status_s         cn78xx;
00744     struct cvmx_dpi_bist_status_cn78xxp1 {
00745 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00746     uint64_t reserved_51_63               : 13;
00747     uint64_t bist                         : 51; /**< BIST results. Hardware sets a bit in BIST for memory that fails. */
00748 #else
00749     uint64_t bist                         : 51;
00750     uint64_t reserved_51_63               : 13;
00751 #endif
00752     } cn78xxp1;
00753     struct cvmx_dpi_bist_status_cn61xx    cnf71xx;
00754     struct cvmx_dpi_bist_status_s         cnf75xx;
00755 };
00756 typedef union cvmx_dpi_bist_status cvmx_dpi_bist_status_t;

00763  */

00771 #else
00772     uint64_t en                           : 1;
00773     uint64_t clk                          : 1;
00774     uint64_t reserved_2_63                : 62;
00775 #endif
00776     } s;
00777     struct cvmx_dpi_ctl_cn61xx {
00778 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD

00781 #else
00782     uint64_t en                           : 1;
00783     uint64_t reserved_1_63                : 63;
00784 #endif
00785     } cn61xx;

00787     struct cvmx_dpi_ctl_s                 cn63xxp1;
00788     struct cvmx_dpi_ctl_s                 cn66xx;

00879                                                          instruction queue. [STATUS]<5> represents the status for first instruction in
00880                                                          instruction order while [STATUS]<0> represents the last or most recent

00902 /**
00903  * cvmx_dpi_dma#_ibuff_saddr
00904  *
00905  * These registers provide the address to start reading instructions for the eight DMA
00906  * instruction queues.
00907  */
00908 union cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr {
00909     uint64_t u64;
00910     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_s {
00911 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00912     uint64_t reserved_62_63               : 2;
00913     uint64_t csize                        : 14; /**< The size in 8-byte words of the DMA instruction chunk. This value should only be written
00914                                                          at known times in order to prevent corruption of the instruction queue. The minimum CSIZE
00915                                                          is 16 (one cache block). */
00916     uint64_t reserved_0_47                : 48;
00917 #else
00918     uint64_t reserved_0_47                : 48;
00919     uint64_t csize                        : 14;
00920     uint64_t reserved_62_63               : 2;
00921 #endif
00922     } s;
00923     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_cn61xx {
00924 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00925     uint64_t reserved_62_63               : 2;
00926     uint64_t csize                        : 14; /**< The size in 8B words of the DMA Instruction Chunk.
00927                                                          This value should only be written at known times
00928                                                          in order to prevent corruption of the instruction
00929                                                          queue.  The minimum CSIZE is 16 (one cacheblock). */
00930     uint64_t reserved_41_47               : 7;
00931     uint64_t idle                         : 1;  /**< DMA Request Queue is IDLE */
00932     uint64_t reserved_36_39               : 4;
00933     uint64_t saddr                        : 29; /**< The 128 byte aligned starting or chunk address.
00934                                                          SADDR is address bit 35:7 of the starting
00935                                                          instructions address. When new chunks are fetched
00936                                                          by the HW, SADDR will be updated to reflect the
00937                                                          address of the current chunk.
00938                                                          A write to SADDR resets both the queue's doorbell
00939                                                          (DPI_DMAx_COUNTS[DBELL) and its tail pointer
00940                                                          (DPI_DMAx_NADDR[ADDR]). */
00941     uint64_t reserved_0_6                 : 7;
00942 #else
00943     uint64_t reserved_0_6                 : 7;
00944     uint64_t saddr                        : 29;
00945     uint64_t reserved_36_39               : 4;
00946     uint64_t idle                         : 1;
00947     uint64_t reserved_41_47               : 7;
00948     uint64_t csize                        : 14;
00949     uint64_t reserved_62_63               : 2;
00950 #endif
00951     } cn61xx;
00952     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_cn61xx cn63xx;
00953     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_cn61xx cn63xxp1;
00954     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_cn61xx cn66xx;
00955     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_cn68xx {
00956 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00957     uint64_t reserved_62_63               : 2;
00958     uint64_t csize                        : 14; /**< The size in 8B words of the DMA Instruction Chunk.
00959                                                          This value should only be written at known times
00960                                                          in order to prevent corruption of the instruction
00961                                                          queue.  The minimum CSIZE is 16 (one cacheblock). */
00962     uint64_t reserved_41_47               : 7;
00963     uint64_t idle                         : 1;  /**< DMA Request Queue is IDLE */
00964     uint64_t saddr                        : 33; /**< The 128 byte aligned starting or chunk address.
00965                                                          SADDR is address bits 39:7 of the starting
00966                                                          instructions address. When new chunks are fetched
00967                                                          by the HW, SADDR will be updated to reflect the
00968                                                          address of the current chunk.
00969                                                          A write to SADDR resets both the queue's doorbell
00970                                                          (DPI_DMAx_COUNTS[DBELL) and its tail pointer
00971                                                          (DPI_DMAx_NADDR[ADDR]). */
00972     uint64_t reserved_0_6                 : 7;
00973 #else
00974     uint64_t reserved_0_6                 : 7;
00975     uint64_t saddr                        : 33;
00976     uint64_t idle                         : 1;
00977     uint64_t reserved_41_47               : 7;
00978     uint64_t csize                        : 14;
00979     uint64_t reserved_62_63               : 2;
00980 #endif
00981     } cn68xx;
00982     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_cn68xx cn68xxp1;
00983     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_cn61xx cn70xx;
00984     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_cn61xx cn70xxp1;
00985     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_cn73xx {
00986 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00987     uint64_t idle                         : 1;  /**< DMA request queue is idle. When asserted, the associated request queue is idle. */
00988     uint64_t reserved_62_62               : 1;
00989     uint64_t csize                        : 14; /**< The size in 8-byte words of the DMA instruction chunk. This value should only be written
00990                                                          at known times in order to prevent corruption of the instruction queue. The minimum CSIZE
00991                                                          is 16 (one cache block). */
00992     uint64_t reserved_42_47               : 6;
00993     uint64_t saddr                        : 35; /**< Starting address. The 128-byte aligned starting or chunk address. SADDR is address bit
00994                                                          <41:7> of the starting instructions address. When new chunks are fetched by the hardware,
00995                                                          SADDR is updated to reflect the address of the current chunk. A write to SADDR resets both
00996                                                          the queue's doorbell (DPI_DMA()_COUNTS[DBELL) and its tail pointer
00997                                                          (DPI_DMA()_NADDR[ADDR]). */
00998     uint64_t reserved_0_6                 : 7;
00999 #else
01000     uint64_t reserved_0_6                 : 7;
01001     uint64_t saddr                        : 35;
01002     uint64_t reserved_42_47               : 6;
01003     uint64_t csize                        : 14;
01004     uint64_t reserved_62_62               : 1;
01005     uint64_t idle                         : 1;
01006 #endif
01007     } cn73xx;
01008     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_cn73xx cn78xx;
01009     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_cn73xx cn78xxp1;
01010     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_cn61xx cnf71xx;
01011     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_cn73xx cnf75xx;
01012 };
01013 typedef union cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr cvmx_dpi_dmax_ibuff_saddr_t;

01049  */
01050 union cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr {

01060     } s;
01061     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr_cn61xx {
01062 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01063     uint64_t reserved_36_63               : 28;
01064     uint64_t addr                         : 36; /**< The next L2C address to read DMA# instructions
01065                                                          from. */
01066 #else
01067     uint64_t addr                         : 36;
01068     uint64_t reserved_36_63               : 28;
01069 #endif
01070     } cn61xx;
01071     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr_cn61xx     cn63xx;
01072     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr_cn61xx     cn63xxp1;
01073     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr_cn61xx     cn66xx;
01074     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr_cn68xx {
01075 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01076     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
01077     uint64_t addr                         : 40; /**< The next L2C address to read DMA# instructions
01078                                                          from. */
01079 #else
01080     uint64_t addr                         : 40;
01081     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
01082 #endif
01083     } cn68xx;
01084     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr_cn68xx     cn68xxp1;
01085     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr_cn61xx     cn70xx;
01086     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr_cn61xx     cn70xxp1;
01087     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr_s          cn73xx;
01088     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr_s          cn78xx;
01089     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr_s          cn78xxp1;
01090     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr_cn61xx     cnf71xx;
01091     struct cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr_s          cnf75xx;
01092 };
01093 typedef union cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr cvmx_dpi_dmax_naddr_t;

01159  *
01160  * This register contains the control bits for transactions on the eight request queues.

01167     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
01168     uint64_t st_cmd                       : 1;  /**< When DPI issues a store full line command to the L2C that is to be cached, this field
01169                                                          select the type of store command to use:
01170                                                          0 = STF.
01171                                                          1 = STY. */
01172     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
01173     uint64_t ld_cmd                       : 2;  /**< When DPI issues a load command to the L2C that is to be cached, this field select the type
01174                                                          of load command to use:
01175                                                          0x0 = LDD.
01176                                                          0x1 = LDI.
01177                                                          0x2 = LDE.
01178                                                          0x3 = LDY. */
01179 #else
01180     uint64_t ld_cmd                       : 2;
01181     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
01182     uint64_t st_cmd                       : 1;
01183     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
01184 #endif
01185     } s;

01193 /**
01194  * cvmx_dpi_dma_control
01195  *
01196  * This register controls the operation of DMA input and output.
01197  *
01198  */
01199 union cvmx_dpi_dma_control {
01200     uint64_t u64;
01201     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_control_s {
01202 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01203     uint64_t reserved_62_63               : 2;
01204     uint64_t dici_mode                    : 1;  /**< DMA Instruction Completion Interrupt Mode
01205                                                          turns on mode to increment DPI_DMA_PPx_CNT
01206                                                          counters. */
01207     uint64_t pkt_en1                      : 1;  /**< Enables the 2nd packet interface.
01208                                                          When the packet interface is enabled, engine 4
01209                                                          is used for packets and is not available for DMA.
01210                                                          The packet interfaces must be enabled in order.
01211                                                          When PKT_EN1=1, then PKT_EN=1.
01212                                                          When PKT_EN1=1, then DMA_ENB<4>=0. */
01213     uint64_t ffp_dis                      : 1;  /**< Force forward progress disable. The DMA engines will compete for shared resources. If the
01214                                                          hardware detects that particular engines are not able to make requests to an interface,
01215                                                          the hardware will periodically trade-off throughput for fairness. */
01216     uint64_t commit_mode                  : 1;  /**< DMA engine commit mode.
01217                                                          When COMMIT_MODE=1, DPI considers an instruction complete when the hardware internally
01218                                                          generates the final write for the current instruction.
01219                                                          When COMMIT_MODE=0, DPI additionally waits for the final write to reach the interface
01220                                                          coherency point to declare the instructions complete.
01221                                                          When COMMIT_MODE=1, DPI may not follow the HRM ordering rules. DPI
01222                                                          hardware performance may be better with COMMIT_MODE=1 than with COMMIT_MODE=0 due to
01223                                                          the relaxed ordering rules. If the HRM ordering rules are required, set COMMIT_MODE=0. */
01224     uint64_t pkt_hp                       : 1;  /**< High-Priority Mode for Packet Interface.
01225                                                          This mode has been deprecated. */
01226     uint64_t pkt_en                       : 1;  /**< Enables the packet interface. When the packet interface is enabled, engines 4 and 5 are
01227                                                          used for packets and are not available for DMA. When PKT_EN=1, then DMA_ENB<5>=0 and
01228                                                          DMA_ENB<4>=0. */
01229     uint64_t reserved_54_55               : 2;
01230     uint64_t dma_enb                      : 6;  /**< DMA engine enable. Enables the operation of the DMA engine. After being enabled an engine
01231                                                          should not be disabled while processing instructions.
01232                                                          When PKT_EN=1, then DMA_ENB<5>=0 and DMA_ENB<4>=0. */
01233     uint64_t wqecsdis                     : 1;  /**< Work queue completion status disable. See DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E.
01234                                                          When [WQECSDIS] is set, DPI never writes completion status into a work queue entry. */
01235     uint64_t wqecsoff                     : 7;  /**< Work queue completion status byte offset. For a DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E::STATUSCA
01236                                                          or DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E::STATUSNC DPI DMA instruction, DPI writes a
01237                                                          non-DPI_CS_E::NOERR (i.e. nonzero) completion status byte to (big-endian
01238                                                          byte address) L2/DRAM address
01239                                                             (DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PTR] & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF8) + [WQECSOFF]
01240                                                          With the reset value 0x7, DPI will write WORD0<7:0> of the WQE. */
01241     uint64_t zbwcsen                      : 1;  /**< Zero-byte-write completion status enable.
01242                                                          See DPI_HDR_PT_E::ZBC_CA and DPI_HDR_PT_E::ZBC_NC. */
01243     uint64_t wqecsmode                    : 2;  /**< WQE completion status mode. Relevant for DPI DMA instructions with
01244                                                          DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PT]=DPI_HDR_PT_E::WQP when [WQECSDIS]=0.
01245                                                          0x0 = Normal behavior. DPI will not write the completion status byte for
01246                                                                DPI_HDR_PT_E::WQP DPI DMA instructions with DPI_CS_E::NOERR (i.e. zero)
01247                                                                completion status, regardless of the DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E selection of
01248                                                                DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PTR<2:0>]. DPI will write the completion
01249                                                                status byte for all other DPI_CS_E (i.e. nonzero) values
01250                                                                when DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PTR<2:0>] is DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E::STATUSCA
01251                                                                or DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E::STATUSNC and [WQECSDIS] is clear.
01252                                                          0x1 = DPI will perform the completion status byte write for all
01253                                                                DPI_HDR_PT_E::WQP DPI DMA instructions when DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PTR<2:0>]
01254                                                                is DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E::STATUSCA or DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E::STATUSNC
01255                                                                and [WQECSDIS] is clear, regardless of the DPI_CS_E completion
01256                                                                status value for the instruction.
01257                                                          0x2 = DPI will not wait for the completion status write commit before issuing
01258                                                                SSO work queue add.
01259                                                          0x3 = Both debug modes specified above (under 0x1 and 0x2) are enabled. */
01260     uint64_t reserved_35_36               : 2;
01261     uint64_t ncb_tag                      : 1;  /**< NCB tag enable. It allows DMA Read/Write transactions over NCB to be mapped to
01262                                                          individual request queues by using tags. This enables more parallelism, giving a
01263                                                          performance boost. */
01264     uint64_t b0_lend                      : 1;  /**< Endian-ness for DPI_HDR_PT_E::ZBC_CA and DPI_HDR_PT_E::ZBC_NC DPI DMA
01265                                                          instructions. When clear, DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PTR] is big-endian for
01266                                                          these instructions. When set, DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PTR] is little-endian
01267                                                          for these instructions. */
01268     uint64_t reserved_20_32               : 13;
01269     uint64_t o_add1                       : 1;  /**< Add one.
01270                                                          0 = The number of bytes in the DMA transfer is added to SLI_DMA()_CNT.
01271                                                          1 = Add 1 to the SLI_DMA()_CNT DMA counters. */
01272     uint64_t o_ro                         : 1;  /**< Relaxed ordering mode for DMA transactions */
01273     uint64_t o_ns                         : 1;  /**< No snoop. */
01274     uint64_t o_es                         : 2;  /**< Endian swap mode for DMA.
01275                                                          See SLI_ENDIANSWAP_E. */
01276     uint64_t o_mode                       : 1;  /**< Select PCI_POINTER mode.
01277                                                          0 = DPTR format 1 is used. Use register values for address; use pointer values for ES, NS,
01278                                                          RO.
01279                                                          1 = DPTR format 0 is used. Use pointer values for address; use register values for ES, NS,
01280                                                          RO. */
01281     uint64_t reserved_0_13                : 14;
01282 #else
01283     uint64_t reserved_0_13                : 14;
01284     uint64_t o_mode                       : 1;
01285     uint64_t o_es                         : 2;
01286     uint64_t o_ns                         : 1;
01287     uint64_t o_ro                         : 1;
01288     uint64_t o_add1                       : 1;
01289     uint64_t reserved_20_32               : 13;
01290     uint64_t b0_lend                      : 1;
01291     uint64_t ncb_tag                      : 1;
01292     uint64_t reserved_35_36               : 2;
01293     uint64_t wqecsmode                    : 2;
01294     uint64_t zbwcsen                      : 1;
01295     uint64_t wqecsoff                     : 7;
01296     uint64_t wqecsdis                     : 1;
01297     uint64_t dma_enb                      : 6;
01298     uint64_t reserved_54_55               : 2;
01299     uint64_t pkt_en                       : 1;
01300     uint64_t pkt_hp                       : 1;
01301     uint64_t commit_mode                  : 1;
01302     uint64_t ffp_dis                      : 1;
01303     uint64_t pkt_en1                      : 1;
01304     uint64_t dici_mode                    : 1;
01305     uint64_t reserved_62_63               : 2;
01306 #endif
01307     } s;
01308     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_control_cn61xx {
01309 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01310     uint64_t reserved_62_63               : 2;
01311     uint64_t dici_mode                    : 1;  /**< DMA Instruction Completion Interrupt Mode
01312                                                          turns on mode to increment DPI_DMA_PPx_CNT
01313                                                          counters. */
01314     uint64_t pkt_en1                      : 1;  /**< Enables the 2nd packet interface.
01315                                                          When the packet interface is enabled, engine 4
01316                                                          is used for packets and is not available for DMA.
01317                                                          The packet interfaces must be enabled in order.
01318                                                          When PKT_EN1=1, then PKT_EN=1.
01319                                                          When PKT_EN1=1, then DMA_ENB<4>=0. */
01320     uint64_t ffp_dis                      : 1;  /**< Force forward progress disable
01321                                                          The DMA engines will compete for shared resources.
01322                                                          If the HW detects that particular engines are not
01323                                                          able to make requests to an interface, the HW
01324                                                          will periodically trade-off throughput for
01325                                                          fairness. */
01326     uint64_t commit_mode                  : 1;  /**< DMA Engine Commit Mode
01327 
01328                                                          When COMMIT_MODE=1, DPI considers an instruction
01329                                                          complete when the HW internally generates the
01330                                                          final write for the current instruction.
01331 
01332                                                          When COMMIT_MODE=0, DPI additionally waits for
01333                                                          the final write to reach the interface coherency
01334                                                          point to declare the instructions complete.
01335 
01336                                                          Please note: when COMMIT_MODE == 1, DPI may not
01337                                                          follow the HRM ordering rules.
01338 
01339                                                          DPI hardware performance may be better with
01340                                                          COMMIT_MODE == 1 than with COMMIT_MODE == 0 due
01341                                                          to the relaxed ordering rules.
01342 
01343                                                          If the HRM ordering rules are required, set
01344                                                          COMMIT_MODE == 0. */
01345     uint64_t pkt_hp                       : 1;  /**< High-Priority Mode for Packet Interface.
01346                                                          This mode has been deprecated. */
01347     uint64_t pkt_en                       : 1;  /**< Enables 1st the packet interface.
01348                                                          When the packet interface is enabled, engine 5
01349                                                          is used for packets and is not available for DMA.
01350                                                          When PKT_EN=1, then DMA_ENB<5>=0.
01351                                                          When PKT_EN1=1, then PKT_EN=1. */
01352     uint64_t reserved_54_55               : 2;
01353     uint64_t dma_enb                      : 6;  /**< DMA engine enable. Enables the operation of the
01354                                                          DMA engine. After being enabled an engine should
01355                                                          not be disabled while processing instructions.
01356                                                          When PKT_EN=1,  then DMA_ENB<5>=0.
01357                                                          When PKT_EN1=1, then DMA_ENB<4>=0. */
01358     uint64_t reserved_34_47               : 14;
01359     uint64_t b0_lend                      : 1;  /**< When set '1' and the DPI is in the mode to write
01360                                                          0 to L2C memory when a DMA is done, the address
01361                                                          to be written to will be treated as a Little
01362                                                          Endian address. */
01363     uint64_t dwb_denb                     : 1;  /**< When set '1', DPI will send a value in the DWB
01364                                                          field for a free page operation for the memory
01365                                                          that contained the data. */
01366     uint64_t dwb_ichk                     : 9;  /**< When Instruction Chunks for DMA operations are
01367                                                          freed this value is used for the DWB field of the
01368                                                          operation. */
01369     uint64_t fpa_que                      : 3;  /**< The FPA queue that the instruction-chunk page will
01370                                                          be returned to when used. */
01371     uint64_t o_add1                       : 1;  /**< When set '1' 1 will be added to the SLI_DMAX_CNT
01372                                                          DMA counters, if '0' then the number of bytes
01373                                                          in the dma transfer will be added to the
01374                                                          SLI_DMAX_CNT count register. */
01375     uint64_t o_ro                         : 1;  /**< Relaxed Ordering Mode for DMA. */
01376     uint64_t o_ns                         : 1;  /**< Nosnoop For DMA. */
01377     uint64_t o_es                         : 2;  /**< Endian Swap Mode for DMA. */
01378     uint64_t o_mode                       : 1;  /**< Select PCI_POINTER MODE to be used.
01379                                                          0=DPTR format 1 is used
01380                                                            use register values for address and pointer
01381                                                            values for ES, NS, RO
01382                                                          1=DPTR format 0 is used
01383                                                            use pointer values for address and register
01384                                                            values for ES, NS, RO */
01385     uint64_t reserved_0_13                : 14;
01386 #else
01387     uint64_t reserved_0_13                : 14;
01388     uint64_t o_mode                       : 1;
01389     uint64_t o_es                         : 2;
01390     uint64_t o_ns                         : 1;
01391     uint64_t o_ro                         : 1;
01392     uint64_t o_add1                       : 1;
01393     uint64_t fpa_que                      : 3;
01394     uint64_t dwb_ichk                     : 9;
01395     uint64_t dwb_denb                     : 1;
01396     uint64_t b0_lend                      : 1;
01397     uint64_t reserved_34_47               : 14;
01398     uint64_t dma_enb                      : 6;
01399     uint64_t reserved_54_55               : 2;
01400     uint64_t pkt_en                       : 1;
01401     uint64_t pkt_hp                       : 1;
01402     uint64_t commit_mode                  : 1;
01403     uint64_t ffp_dis                      : 1;
01404     uint64_t pkt_en1                      : 1;
01405     uint64_t dici_mode                    : 1;
01406     uint64_t reserved_62_63               : 2;
01407 #endif
01408     } cn61xx;
01409     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_control_cn63xx {
01410 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01411     uint64_t reserved_61_63               : 3;
01412     uint64_t pkt_en1                      : 1;  /**< Enables the 2nd packet interface.
01413                                                          When the packet interface is enabled, engine 4
01414                                                          is used for packets and is not available for DMA.
01415                                                          The packet interfaces must be enabled in order.
01416                                                          When PKT_EN1=1, then PKT_EN=1.
01417                                                          When PKT_EN1=1, then DMA_ENB<4>=0. */
01418     uint64_t ffp_dis                      : 1;  /**< Force forward progress disable
01419                                                          The DMA engines will compete for shared resources.
01420                                                          If the HW detects that particular engines are not
01421                                                          able to make requests to an interface, the HW
01422                                                          will periodically trade-off throughput for
01423                                                          fairness. */
01424     uint64_t commit_mode                  : 1;  /**< DMA Engine Commit Mode
01425 
01426                                                          When COMMIT_MODE=0, DPI considers an instruction
01427                                                          complete when the HW internally generates the
01428                                                          final write for the current instruction.
01429 
01430                                                          When COMMIT_MODE=1, DPI additionally waits for
01431                                                          the final write to reach the interface coherency
01432                                                          point to declare the instructions complete.
01433 
01434                                                          Please note: when COMMIT_MODE == 0, DPI may not
01435                                                          follow the HRM ordering rules.
01436 
01437                                                          DPI hardware performance may be better with
01438                                                          COMMIT_MODE == 0 than with COMMIT_MODE == 1 due
01439                                                          to the relaxed ordering rules.
01440 
01441                                                          If the HRM ordering rules are required, set
01442                                                          COMMIT_MODE == 1. */
01443     uint64_t pkt_hp                       : 1;  /**< High-Priority Mode for Packet Interface.
01444                                                          This mode has been deprecated. */
01445     uint64_t pkt_en                       : 1;  /**< Enables 1st the packet interface.
01446                                                          When the packet interface is enabled, engine 5
01447                                                          is used for packets and is not available for DMA.
01448                                                          When PKT_EN=1, then DMA_ENB<5>=0.
01449                                                          When PKT_EN1=1, then PKT_EN=1. */
01450     uint64_t reserved_54_55               : 2;
01451     uint64_t dma_enb                      : 6;  /**< DMA engine enable. Enables the operation of the
01452                                                          DMA engine. After being enabled an engine should
01453                                                          not be disabled while processing instructions.
01454                                                          When PKT_EN=1,  then DMA_ENB<5>=0.
01455                                                          When PKT_EN1=1, then DMA_ENB<4>=0. */
01456     uint64_t reserved_34_47               : 14;
01457     uint64_t b0_lend                      : 1;  /**< When set '1' and the DPI is in the mode to write
01458                                                          0 to L2C memory when a DMA is done, the address
01459                                                          to be written to will be treated as a Little
01460                                                          Endian address. */
01461     uint64_t dwb_denb                     : 1;  /**< When set '1', DPI will send a value in the DWB
01462                                                          field for a free page operation for the memory
01463                                                          that contained the data. */
01464     uint64_t dwb_ichk                     : 9;  /**< When Instruction Chunks for DMA operations are
01465                                                          freed this value is used for the DWB field of the
01466                                                          operation. */
01467     uint64_t fpa_que                      : 3;  /**< The FPA queue that the instruction-chunk page will
01468                                                          be returned to when used. */
01469     uint64_t o_add1                       : 1;  /**< When set '1' 1 will be added to the DMA counters,
01470                                                          if '0' then the number of bytes in the dma
01471                                                          transfer will be added to the count register. */
01472     uint64_t o_ro                         : 1;  /**< Relaxed Ordering Mode for DMA. */
01473     uint64_t o_ns                         : 1;  /**< Nosnoop For DMA. */
01474     uint64_t o_es                         : 2;  /**< Endian Swap Mode for DMA. */
01475     uint64_t o_mode                       : 1;  /**< Select PCI_POINTER MODE to be used.
01476                                                          0=DPTR format 1 is used
01477                                                            use register values for address and pointer
01478                                                            values for ES, NS, RO
01479                                                          1=DPTR format 0 is used
01480                                                            use pointer values for address and register
01481                                                            values for ES, NS, RO */
01482     uint64_t reserved_0_13                : 14;
01483 #else
01484     uint64_t reserved_0_13                : 14;
01485     uint64_t o_mode                       : 1;
01486     uint64_t o_es                         : 2;
01487     uint64_t o_ns                         : 1;
01488     uint64_t o_ro                         : 1;
01489     uint64_t o_add1                       : 1;
01490     uint64_t fpa_que                      : 3;
01491     uint64_t dwb_ichk                     : 9;
01492     uint64_t dwb_denb                     : 1;
01493     uint64_t b0_lend                      : 1;
01494     uint64_t reserved_34_47               : 14;
01495     uint64_t dma_enb                      : 6;
01496     uint64_t reserved_54_55               : 2;
01497     uint64_t pkt_en                       : 1;
01498     uint64_t pkt_hp                       : 1;
01499     uint64_t commit_mode                  : 1;
01500     uint64_t ffp_dis                      : 1;
01501     uint64_t pkt_en1                      : 1;
01502     uint64_t reserved_61_63               : 3;
01503 #endif
01504     } cn63xx;
01505     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_control_cn63xxp1 {
01506 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01507     uint64_t reserved_59_63               : 5;
01508     uint64_t commit_mode                  : 1;  /**< DMA Engine Commit Mode
01509 
01510                                                          When COMMIT_MODE=1, DPI considers an instruction
01511                                                          complete when the HW internally generates the
01512                                                          final write for the current instruction.
01513 
01514                                                          When COMMIT_MODE=0, DPI additionally waits for
01515                                                          the final write to reach the interface coherency
01516                                                          point to declare the instructions complete.
01517 
01518                                                          Please note: when COMMIT_MODE == 1, DPI may not
01519                                                          follow the HRM ordering rules.
01520 
01521                                                          DPI hardware performance may be better with
01522                                                          COMMIT_MODE == 1 than with COMMIT_MODE == 0 due
01523                                                          to the relaxed ordering rules.
01524 
01525                                                          If the HRM ordering rules are required, set
01526                                                          COMMIT_MODE == 0. */
01527     uint64_t pkt_hp                       : 1;  /**< High-Priority Mode for Packet Interface.
01528                                                          Engine 5 will be serviced more frequently to
01529                                                          deliver more bandwidth to packet interface.
01530                                                          When PKT_EN=0, then PKT_HP=0. */
01531     uint64_t pkt_en                       : 1;  /**< Enables the packet interface.
01532                                                          When the packet interface is enabled, engine 5
01533                                                          is used for packets and is not available for DMA.
01534                                                          When PKT_EN=1, then DMA_ENB<5>=0.
01535                                                          When PKT_EN=0, then PKT_HP=0. */
01536     uint64_t reserved_54_55               : 2;
01537     uint64_t dma_enb                      : 6;  /**< DMA engine enable. Enables the operation of the
01538                                                          DMA engine. After being enabled an engine should
01539                                                          not be disabled while processing instructions.
01540                                                          When PKT_EN=1, then DMA_ENB<5>=0. */
01541     uint64_t reserved_34_47               : 14;
01542     uint64_t b0_lend                      : 1;  /**< When set '1' and the DPI is in the mode to write
01543                                                          0 to L2C memory when a DMA is done, the address
01544                                                          to be written to will be treated as a Little
01545                                                          Endian address. */
01546     uint64_t dwb_denb                     : 1;  /**< When set '1', DPI will send a value in the DWB
01547                                                          field for a free page operation for the memory
01548                                                          that contained the data. */
01549     uint64_t dwb_ichk                     : 9;  /**< When Instruction Chunks for DMA operations are
01550                                                          freed this value is used for the DWB field of the
01551                                                          operation. */
01552     uint64_t fpa_que                      : 3;  /**< The FPA queue that the instruction-chunk page will
01553                                                          be returned to when used. */
01554     uint64_t o_add1                       : 1;  /**< When set '1' 1 will be added to the DMA counters,
01555                                                          if '0' then the number of bytes in the dma
01556                                                          transfer will be added to the count register. */
01557     uint64_t o_ro                         : 1;  /**< Relaxed Ordering Mode for DMA. */
01558     uint64_t o_ns                         : 1;  /**< Nosnoop For DMA. */
01559     uint64_t o_es                         : 2;  /**< Endian Swap Mode for DMA. */
01560     uint64_t o_mode                       : 1;  /**< Select PCI_POINTER MODE to be used.
01561                                                          0=DPTR format 1 is used
01562                                                            use register values for address and pointer
01563                                                            values for ES, NS, RO
01564                                                          1=DPTR format 0 is used
01565                                                            use pointer values for address and register
01566                                                            values for ES, NS, RO */
01567     uint64_t reserved_0_13                : 14;
01568 #else
01569     uint64_t reserved_0_13                : 14;
01570     uint64_t o_mode                       : 1;
01571     uint64_t o_es                         : 2;
01572     uint64_t o_ns                         : 1;
01573     uint64_t o_ro                         : 1;
01574     uint64_t o_add1                       : 1;
01575     uint64_t fpa_que                      : 3;
01576     uint64_t dwb_ichk                     : 9;
01577     uint64_t dwb_denb                     : 1;
01578     uint64_t b0_lend                      : 1;
01579     uint64_t reserved_34_47               : 14;
01580     uint64_t dma_enb                      : 6;
01581     uint64_t reserved_54_55               : 2;
01582     uint64_t pkt_en                       : 1;
01583     uint64_t pkt_hp                       : 1;
01584     uint64_t commit_mode                  : 1;
01585     uint64_t reserved_59_63               : 5;
01586 #endif
01587     } cn63xxp1;
01588     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_control_cn63xx    cn66xx;
01589     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_control_cn61xx    cn68xx;
01590     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_control_cn63xx    cn68xxp1;
01591     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_control_cn61xx    cn70xx;
01592     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_control_cn61xx    cn70xxp1;
01593     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_control_cn73xx {
01594 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01595     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
01596     uint64_t ffp_dis                      : 1;  /**< Force forward progress disable. The DMA engines will compete for shared resources. If the
01597                                                          hardware detects that particular engines are not able to make requests to an interface,
01598                                                          the hardware will periodically trade-off throughput for fairness. */
01599     uint64_t commit_mode                  : 1;  /**< DMA engine commit mode.
01600                                                          When COMMIT_MODE=1, DPI considers an instruction complete when the hardware internally
01601                                                          generates the final write for the current instruction.
01602                                                          When COMMIT_MODE=0, DPI additionally waits for the final write to reach the interface
01603                                                          coherency point to declare the instructions complete.
01604                                                          When COMMIT_MODE=1, DPI may not follow the HRM ordering rules. DPI
01605                                                          hardware performance may be better with COMMIT_MODE=1 than with COMMIT_MODE=0 due to
01606                                                          the relaxed ordering rules. If the HRM ordering rules are required, set COMMIT_MODE=0. */
01607     uint64_t reserved_57_57               : 1;
01608     uint64_t pkt_en                       : 1;  /**< Enables the packet interface. When the packet interface is enabled, engines 4 and 5 are
01609                                                          used for packets and are not available for DMA. When PKT_EN=1, then DMA_ENB<5>=0 and
01610                                                          DMA_ENB<4>=0. */
01611     uint64_t reserved_54_55               : 2;
01612     uint64_t dma_enb                      : 6;  /**< DMA engine enable. Enables the operation of the DMA engine. After being enabled an engine
01613                                                          should not be disabled while processing instructions.
01614                                                          When PKT_EN=1, then DMA_ENB<5>=0 and DMA_ENB<4>=0. */
01615     uint64_t wqecsdis                     : 1;  /**< Work queue completion status disable. See DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E.
01616                                                          When [WQECSDIS] is set, DPI never writes completion status into a work queue entry. */
01617     uint64_t wqecsoff                     : 7;  /**< Work queue completion status byte offset. For a DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E::STATUSCA
01618                                                          or DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E::STATUSNC DPI DMA instruction, DPI writes a
01619                                                          non-DPI_CS_E::NOERR (i.e. nonzero) completion status byte to (big-endian
01620                                                          byte address) L2/DRAM address
01621                                                             (DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PTR] & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF8) + [WQECSOFF]
01622                                                          With the reset value 0x7, DPI will write WORD0<7:0> of the WQE. */
01623     uint64_t zbwcsen                      : 1;  /**< Zero-byte-write completion status enable.
01624                                                          See DPI_HDR_PT_E::ZBC_CA and DPI_HDR_PT_E::ZBC_NC. */
01625     uint64_t wqecsmode                    : 2;  /**< WQE completion status mode. Relevant for DPI DMA instructions with
01626                                                          DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PT]=DPI_HDR_PT_E::WQP when [WQECSDIS]=0.
01627                                                          0x0 = Normal behavior. DPI will not write the completion status byte for
01628                                                                DPI_HDR_PT_E::WQP DPI DMA instructions with DPI_CS_E::NOERR (i.e. zero)
01629                                                                completion status, regardless of the DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E selection of
01630                                                                DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PTR<2:0>]. DPI will write the completion
01631                                                                status byte for all other DPI_CS_E (i.e. nonzero) values
01632                                                                when DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PTR<2:0>] is DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E::STATUSCA
01633                                                                or DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E::STATUSNC and [WQECSDIS] is clear.
01634                                                          0x1 = DPI will perform the completion status byte write for all
01635                                                                DPI_HDR_PT_E::WQP DPI DMA instructions when DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PTR<2:0>]
01636                                                                is DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E::STATUSCA or DPI_HDR_PT_WQP_E::STATUSNC
01637                                                                and [WQECSDIS] is clear, regardless of the DPI_CS_E completion
01638                                                                status value for the instruction.
01639                                                          0x2 = DPI will not wait for the completion status write commit before issuing
01640                                                                SSO work queue add.
01641                                                          0x3 = Both debug modes specified above (under 0x1 and 0x2) are enabled. */
01642     uint64_t reserved_35_36               : 2;
01643     uint64_t ncb_tag                      : 1;  /**< NCB tag enable. It allows DMA Read/Write transactions over NCB to be mapped to
01644                                                          individual request queues by using tags. This enables more parallelism, giving a
01645                                                          performance boost. */
01646     uint64_t b0_lend                      : 1;  /**< Endian-ness for DPI_HDR_PT_E::ZBC_CA and DPI_HDR_PT_E::ZBC_NC DPI DMA
01647                                                          instructions. When clear, DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PTR] is big-endian for
01648                                                          these instructions. When set, DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PTR] is little-endian
01649                                                          for these instructions. */
01650     uint64_t ldwb                         : 1;  /**< Load don't write back. When set, the hardware is able to issue LDWB commands for pointers
01651                                                          that are being freed. As a result, the line will not be written back when replaced.
01652                                                          When clear, the hardware issues regular load commands to the cache which cause the
01653                                                          line to be written back before being replaced. */
01654     uint64_t aura_ichk                    : 12; /**< AURA instruction chunk. The AURA that the instruction chunk for DMA operations page will
01655                                                          be returned to when freed. */
01656     uint64_t o_add1                       : 1;  /**< Add one.
01657                                                          0 = The number of bytes in the DMA transfer is added to SLI_DMA()_CNT.
01658                                                          1 = Add 1 to the SLI_DMA()_CNT DMA counters. */
01659     uint64_t o_ro                         : 1;  /**< Relaxed ordering mode for DMA transactions */
01660     uint64_t o_ns                         : 1;  /**< No snoop. */
01661     uint64_t o_es                         : 2;  /**< Endian swap mode for DMA.
01662                                                          See SLI_ENDIANSWAP_E. */
01663     uint64_t o_mode                       : 1;  /**< Select PCI_POINTER mode.
01664                                                          0 = DPTR format 1 is used. Use register values for address; use pointer values for ES, NS,
01665                                                          RO.
01666                                                          1 = DPTR format 0 is used. Use pointer values for address; use register values for ES, NS,
01667                                                          RO. */
01668     uint64_t reserved_0_13                : 14;
01669 #else
01670     uint64_t reserved_0_13                : 14;
01671     uint64_t o_mode                       : 1;
01672     uint64_t o_es                         : 2;
01673     uint64_t o_ns                         : 1;
01674     uint64_t o_ro                         : 1;
01675     uint64_t o_add1                       : 1;
01676     uint64_t aura_ichk                    : 12;
01677     uint64_t ldwb                         : 1;
01678     uint64_t b0_lend                      : 1;
01679     uint64_t ncb_tag                      : 1;
01680     uint64_t reserved_35_36               : 2;
01681     uint64_t wqecsmode                    : 2;
01682     uint64_t zbwcsen                      : 1;
01683     uint64_t wqecsoff                     : 7;
01684     uint64_t wqecsdis                     : 1;
01685     uint64_t dma_enb                      : 6;
01686     uint64_t reserved_54_55               : 2;
01687     uint64_t pkt_en                       : 1;
01688     uint64_t reserved_57_57               : 1;
01689     uint64_t commit_mode                  : 1;
01690     uint64_t ffp_dis                      : 1;
01691     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
01692 #endif
01693     } cn73xx;
01694     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_control_cn73xx    cn78xx;
01695     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_control_cn73xx    cn78xxp1;
01696     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_control_cn61xx    cnf71xx;
01697     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_control_cn73xx    cnf75xx;
01698 };
01699 typedef union cvmx_dpi_dma_control cvmx_dpi_dma_control_t;

01706  */
01707 union cvmx_dpi_dma_engx_en {

01711     uint64_t reserved_39_63               : 25;
01712     uint64_t eng_molr                     : 7;  /**< Per-engine maximum outstanding read request. 0x0 means no maximum per engine
01713                                                          (although it will be still limited by the per port MOLR value.) */
01714     uint64_t reserved_8_31                : 24;
01715     uint64_t qen                          : 8;  /**< Instruction queue enable. This field specifies which of eight logical instruction queues
01716                                                          can be serviced by the DMA engine.

01718                                                            1 = Allow service.
01719                                                          Setting QEN = 0x0 effectively disables the engine. When DPI_DMA_CONTROL[PKT_EN] = 1, then
01720                                                          DPI_DMA_ENG4/5_EN [QEN] must be zero. */

01732                                                          serviced by the DMA engine. Setting QEN==0
01733                                                          effectively disables the engine.

01758 /**
01759  * cvmx_dpi_dma_pp#_cnt
01760  *
01761  * DPI_DMA_PP[0..3]_CNT  = DMA per PP Instr Done Counter
01762  * When DMA Instruction Completion Interrupt Mode DPI_DMA_CONTROL.DICI_MODE is enabled, every dma
01763  * instruction
01764  * that has the WQP=0 and a PTR value of 1..4 will incremrement DPI_DMA_PPx_CNT value-1 counter.
01765  * Instructions with WQP=0 and PTR values higher then 0x3F will still send a zero byte write.
01766  * Hardware reserves that values 5..63 for future use and will treat them as a PTR of 0 and do
01767  * nothing.
01768  */
01769 union cvmx_dpi_dma_ppx_cnt {
01770     uint64_t u64;
01771     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_ppx_cnt_s {
01772 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01773     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
01774     uint64_t cnt                          : 16; /**< DPI DMA per-core instruction completion counter. DPI can increment a counter upon
01775                                                          completion of a DPI DMA instruction. DPI subtracts the value written
01776                                                          from [CNT] on a software write. A nonzero [CNT] asserts the corresponding
01777                                                          DPI_DMA_PP_INT bit and a 0->1 [CNT] transition throws the corresponding
01778                                                          DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_DMA_PP()_INT.
01779                                                          DPI increments the [CNT] selected by DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PTR] by one after completing
01780                                                          a DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[PT]=DPI_HDR_PT_E::CNT DPI DMA instruction. */
01781 #else
01782     uint64_t cnt                          : 16;
01783     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
01784 #endif
01785     } s;
01786     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_ppx_cnt_s         cn61xx;
01787     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_ppx_cnt_s         cn68xx;
01788     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_ppx_cnt_s         cn70xx;
01789     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_ppx_cnt_s         cn70xxp1;
01790     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_ppx_cnt_s         cn73xx;
01791     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_ppx_cnt_s         cn78xx;
01792     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_ppx_cnt_s         cn78xxp1;
01793     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_ppx_cnt_s         cnf71xx;
01794     struct cvmx_dpi_dma_ppx_cnt_s         cnf75xx;
01795 };
01796 typedef union cvmx_dpi_dma_ppx_cnt cvmx_dpi_dma_ppx_cnt_t;

01829 /**

01832  * This register allows inserting ECC errors for testing.

01834  */
01835 union cvmx_dpi_ecc_ctl {
01836     uint64_t u64;
01837     struct cvmx_dpi_ecc_ctl_s {
01838 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01839     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
01840     uint64_t ram_cdis                     : 1;  /**< RDB RAM ECC correction disable. Each bit corresponds to a different RAM. */
01841     uint64_t reserved_17_31               : 15;
01842     uint64_t ram_flip1                    : 1;  /**< Flip syndrome bits on write. Flip syndrome bits <1> on writes to the corresponding RDB RAM
01843                                                          to test single-bit or double-bit error handling. */
01844     uint64_t reserved_1_15                : 15;
01845     uint64_t ram_flip0                    : 1;  /**< Flip syndrome bits on write. Flip syndrome bits <0> on writes to the corresponding RDB RAM
01846                                                          to test single-bit or double-bit error handling. */
01847 #else
01848     uint64_t ram_flip0                    : 1;
01849     uint64_t reserved_1_15                : 15;
01850     uint64_t ram_flip1                    : 1;
01851     uint64_t reserved_17_31               : 15;
01852     uint64_t ram_cdis                     : 1;
01853     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
01854 #endif
01855     } s;

01863 /**
01864  * cvmx_dpi_ecc_int
01865  *
01866  * This register contains ECC error interrupt summary bits.
01867  *
01868  */
01869 union cvmx_dpi_ecc_int {
01870     uint64_t u64;
01871     struct cvmx_dpi_ecc_int_s {
01872 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01873     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
01874     uint64_t ram_sbe                      : 15; /**< Set when a single-bit error is detected in the corresponding RAM. Throws
01875                                                          DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_ERR_RAM_SBE(). */
01876     uint64_t reserved_15_31               : 17;
01877     uint64_t ram_dbe                      : 15; /**< Set when a double-bit error is detected in the corresponding RAM. Throws
01878                                                          DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_ERR_RAM_DBE(). */
01879 #else
01880     uint64_t ram_dbe                      : 15;
01881     uint64_t reserved_15_31               : 17;
01882     uint64_t ram_sbe                      : 15;
01883     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
01884 #endif
01885     } s;
01886     struct cvmx_dpi_ecc_int_s             cn73xx;
01887     struct cvmx_dpi_ecc_int_s             cn78xx;
01888     struct cvmx_dpi_ecc_int_s             cn78xxp1;
01889     struct cvmx_dpi_ecc_int_s             cnf75xx;
01890 };
01891 typedef union cvmx_dpi_ecc_int cvmx_dpi_ecc_int_t;
01892 
01893 /**
01894  * cvmx_dpi_eng#_buf
01895  *
01896  * Notes:
01897  * The total amount of storage allocated to the 6 DPI DMA engines (via DPI_ENG*_BUF[BLKS]) must not exceed 8KB.
01898  *
01899  */
01900 union cvmx_dpi_engx_buf {
01901     uint64_t u64;
01902     struct cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_s {
01903 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01904     uint64_t reserved_38_63               : 26;
01905     uint64_t compblks                     : 6;  /**< Computed engine block size */
01906     uint64_t reserved_10_31               : 22;
01907     uint64_t base                         : 6;  /**< The base address in 512-byte blocks of the DMA engine FIFO. */
01908     uint64_t blks                         : 4;  /**< The size of the DMA engine FIFO. The sum of the allocated FIFOs across all six
01909                                                          DPI_ENG()_BUF[BLKS] registers must not exceed the overall RDB memory size of
01910                                                          32 KB.
01911                                                          0x0 = Engine disabled.
01912                                                          0x1 = 0.5 KB FIFO.
01913                                                          0x2 = 1.0 KB FIFO.
01914                                                          0x3 = 1.5 KB FIFO.
01915                                                          0x4 = 2.0 KB FIFO.
01916                                                          0x5 = 2.5 KB FIFO.
01917                                                          0x6 = 3.0 KB FIFO.
01918                                                          0x7 = 3.5 KB FIFO.
01919                                                          0x8 = 4.0 KB FIFO.
01920                                                          0x9 = 6.0 KB FIFO.
01921                                                          0xA = 8.0 KB FIFO.
01922                                                          0xB = 16.0 KB FIFO. */
01923 #else
01924     uint64_t blks                         : 4;
01925     uint64_t base                         : 6;
01926     uint64_t reserved_10_31               : 22;
01927     uint64_t compblks                     : 6;
01928     uint64_t reserved_38_63               : 26;
01929 #endif
01930     } s;
01931     struct cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_cn61xx {
01932 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01933     uint64_t reserved_37_63               : 27;
01934     uint64_t compblks                     : 5;  /**< Computed engine block size */
01935     uint64_t reserved_9_31                : 23;
01936     uint64_t base                         : 5;  /**< The base address in 512B blocks of the engine fifo */
01937     uint64_t blks                         : 4;  /**< The size of the engine fifo
01938                                                          Legal values are 0-10.
01939                                                          0  = Engine is disabled
01940                                                          1  = 0.5KB buffer
01941                                                          2  = 1.0KB buffer
01942                                                          3  = 1.5KB buffer
01943                                                          4  = 2.0KB buffer
01944                                                          5  = 2.5KB buffer
01945                                                          6  = 3.0KB buffer
01946                                                          7  = 3.5KB buffer
01947                                                          8  = 4.0KB buffer
01948                                                          9  = 6.0KB buffer
01949                                                          10 = 8.0KB buffer */
01950 #else
01951     uint64_t blks                         : 4;
01952     uint64_t base                         : 5;
01953     uint64_t reserved_9_31                : 23;
01954     uint64_t compblks                     : 5;
01955     uint64_t reserved_37_63               : 27;
01956 #endif
01957     } cn61xx;
01958     struct cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_cn63xx {
01959 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01960     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
01961     uint64_t base                         : 4;  /**< The base address in 512B blocks of the engine fifo */
01962     uint64_t blks                         : 4;  /**< The size in 512B blocks of the engine fifo
01963                                                          Legal values are 0-8.
01964                                                          0 = Engine is disabled
01965                                                          1 = 0.5KB buffer
01966                                                          2 = 1.0KB buffer
01967                                                          3 = 1.5KB buffer
01968                                                          4 = 2.0KB buffer
01969                                                          5 = 2.5KB buffer
01970                                                          6 = 3.0KB buffer
01971                                                          7 = 3.5KB buffer
01972                                                          8 = 4.0KB buffer */
01973 #else
01974     uint64_t blks                         : 4;
01975     uint64_t base                         : 4;
01976     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
01977 #endif
01978     } cn63xx;
01979     struct cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_cn63xx       cn63xxp1;
01980     struct cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_cn61xx       cn66xx;
01981     struct cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_cn61xx       cn68xx;
01982     struct cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_cn61xx       cn68xxp1;
01983     struct cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_cn61xx       cn70xx;
01984     struct cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_cn61xx       cn70xxp1;
01985     struct cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_s            cn73xx;
01986     struct cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_s            cn78xx;
01987     struct cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_s            cn78xxp1;
01988     struct cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_cn61xx       cnf71xx;
01989     struct cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_s            cnf75xx;
01990 };
01991 typedef union cvmx_dpi_engx_buf cvmx_dpi_engx_buf_t;
