02195 /**
02196  * cvmx_dpi_int_reg
02197  *
02198  * This register contains error flags for DPI.
02199  *
02200  */
02201 union cvmx_dpi_int_reg {
02202     uint64_t u64;
02203     struct cvmx_dpi_int_reg_s {
02204 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02205     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
02206     uint64_t sprt3_rst                    : 1;  /**< DMA instruction was dropped because the source or
02207                                                           destination port was in reset.
02208                                                          this bit is set. */
02209     uint64_t sprt2_rst                    : 1;  /**< DMA instruction was dropped because the source or
02210                                                           destination port was in reset.
02211                                                          this bit is set. */
02212     uint64_t sprt1_rst                    : 1;  /**< DMA instruction was dropped because the source or
02213                                                           destination port was in reset.
02214                                                          this bit is set. */
02215     uint64_t sprt0_rst                    : 1;  /**< DMA instruction was dropped because the source or
02216                                                           destination port was in reset.
02217                                                          this bit is set. */
02218     uint64_t reserved_23_23               : 1;
02219     uint64_t req_badfil                   : 1;  /**< Unexpected fill error. This bit is set when an instruction fill is received when there is
02220                                                          no outstanding request. Throws DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_REQ_BADFIL. */
02221     uint64_t req_inull                    : 1;  /**< Interrupt should be ignored. */
02222     uint64_t req_anull                    : 1;  /**< Instruction bad error. This bit is set when a fetched instruction word was 0x0. Throws
02223                                                          DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_REQ_ANULL. */
02224     uint64_t req_undflw                   : 1;  /**< Instruction FIFO underflow error. This bit is set when the instruction FIFO underflows.
02225                                                          Throws DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_REQ_UNDFLW. */
02226     uint64_t req_ovrflw                   : 1;  /**< Instruction FIFO overflow error. This bit is set when the instruction FIFO overflows.
02227                                                          Throws DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_REQ_OVRFLW. */
02228     uint64_t req_badlen                   : 1;  /**< Fetch with length zero error. This bit is set when DPI forms an instruction fetch with
02229                                                          length of zero. Throws DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_REQ_BADLEN. */
02230     uint64_t req_badadr                   : 1;  /**< Fetch with bad pointer error. This bit is set when DPI forms an instruction fetch to the
02231                                                          NULL pointer. Throws DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_REQ_BADADR. */
02232     uint64_t dmadbo                       : 8;  /**< Doorbell overflow error. DPI has a 32-bit counter for each request queue's outstanding
02233                                                          doorbell counts. A bit is set when the corresponding doorbell count overflows. Throws
02234                                                          DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_DMADBO(). */
02235     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
02236     uint64_t nfovr                        : 1;  /**< CSR FIFO overflow error. DPI can store up to 16 CSR requests, and the FIFO overflows if
02237                                                          that number is exceeded. Throws DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_NFOVR. */
02238     uint64_t nderr                        : 1;  /**< IOI decode error. This bit is set when the DPI received an IOI transaction on the outbound
02239                                                          bus to the DPI device ID, but the command was not recognized. Throws
02240                                                          DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_NDERR. */
02241 #else
02242     uint64_t nderr                        : 1;
02243     uint64_t nfovr                        : 1;
02244     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
02245     uint64_t dmadbo                       : 8;
02246     uint64_t req_badadr                   : 1;
02247     uint64_t req_badlen                   : 1;
02248     uint64_t req_ovrflw                   : 1;
02249     uint64_t req_undflw                   : 1;
02250     uint64_t req_anull                    : 1;
02251     uint64_t req_inull                    : 1;
02252     uint64_t req_badfil                   : 1;
02253     uint64_t reserved_23_23               : 1;
02254     uint64_t sprt0_rst                    : 1;
02255     uint64_t sprt1_rst                    : 1;
02256     uint64_t sprt2_rst                    : 1;
02257     uint64_t sprt3_rst                    : 1;
02258     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
02259 #endif
02260     } s;
02261     struct cvmx_dpi_int_reg_s             cn61xx;
02262     struct cvmx_dpi_int_reg_cn63xx {
02263 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02264     uint64_t reserved_26_63               : 38;
02265     uint64_t sprt1_rst                    : 1;  /**< DMA instruction was dropped because the source or
02266                                                           destination port was in reset.
02267                                                          this bit is set. */
02268     uint64_t sprt0_rst                    : 1;  /**< DMA instruction was dropped because the source or
02269                                                           destination port was in reset.
02270                                                          this bit is set. */
02271     uint64_t reserved_23_23               : 1;
02272     uint64_t req_badfil                   : 1;  /**< DMA instruction unexpected fill
02273                                                          Instruction fill when none outstanding. */
02274     uint64_t req_inull                    : 1;  /**< DMA instruction filled with NULL pointer
02275                                                          Next pointer was NULL. */
02276     uint64_t req_anull                    : 1;  /**< DMA instruction filled with bad instruction
02277                                                          Fetched instruction word was 0. */
02278     uint64_t req_undflw                   : 1;  /**< DMA instruction FIFO underflow
02279                                                          DPI tracks outstanding instructions fetches.
02280                                                          Interrupt will fire when FIFO underflows. */
02281     uint64_t req_ovrflw                   : 1;  /**< DMA instruction FIFO overflow
02282                                                          DPI tracks outstanding instructions fetches.
02283                                                          Interrupt will fire when FIFO overflows. */
02284     uint64_t req_badlen                   : 1;  /**< DMA instruction fetch with length
02285                                                          Interrupt will fire if DPI forms an instruction
02286                                                          fetch with length of zero. */
02287     uint64_t req_badadr                   : 1;  /**< DMA instruction fetch with bad pointer
02288                                                          Interrupt will fire if DPI forms an instruction
02289                                                          fetch to the NULL pointer. */
02290     uint64_t dmadbo                       : 8;  /**< DMAx doorbell overflow.
02291                                                          DPI has a 32-bit counter for each request's queue
02292                                                          outstanding doorbell counts. Interrupt will fire
02293                                                          if the count overflows. */
02294     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
02295     uint64_t nfovr                        : 1;  /**< CSR Fifo Overflow
02296                                                          DPI can store upto 16 CSR request.  The FIFO will
02297                                                          overflow if that number is exceeded. */
02298     uint64_t nderr                        : 1;  /**< NCB Decode Error
02299                                                          DPI received a NCB transaction on the outbound
02300                                                          bus to the DPI deviceID, but the command was not
02301                                                          recognized. */
02302 #else
02303     uint64_t nderr                        : 1;
02304     uint64_t nfovr                        : 1;
02305     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
02306     uint64_t dmadbo                       : 8;
02307     uint64_t req_badadr                   : 1;
02308     uint64_t req_badlen                   : 1;
02309     uint64_t req_ovrflw                   : 1;
02310     uint64_t req_undflw                   : 1;
02311     uint64_t req_anull                    : 1;
02312     uint64_t req_inull                    : 1;
02313     uint64_t req_badfil                   : 1;
02314     uint64_t reserved_23_23               : 1;
02315     uint64_t sprt0_rst                    : 1;
02316     uint64_t sprt1_rst                    : 1;
02317     uint64_t reserved_26_63               : 38;
02318 #endif
02319     } cn63xx;
02320     struct cvmx_dpi_int_reg_cn63xx        cn63xxp1;
02321     struct cvmx_dpi_int_reg_s             cn66xx;
02322     struct cvmx_dpi_int_reg_cn63xx        cn68xx;
02323     struct cvmx_dpi_int_reg_cn63xx        cn68xxp1;
02324     struct cvmx_dpi_int_reg_s             cn70xx;
02325     struct cvmx_dpi_int_reg_s             cn70xxp1;
02326     struct cvmx_dpi_int_reg_cn73xx {
02327 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02328     uint64_t reserved_23_63               : 41;
02329     uint64_t req_badfil                   : 1;  /**< Unexpected fill error. This bit is set when an instruction fill is received when there is
02330                                                          no outstanding request. Throws DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_REQ_BADFIL. */
02331     uint64_t req_inull                    : 1;  /**< Interrupt should be ignored. */
02332     uint64_t req_anull                    : 1;  /**< Instruction bad error. This bit is set when a fetched instruction word was 0x0. Throws
02333                                                          DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_REQ_ANULL. */
02334     uint64_t req_undflw                   : 1;  /**< Instruction FIFO underflow error. This bit is set when the instruction FIFO underflows.
02335                                                          Throws DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_REQ_UNDFLW. */
02336     uint64_t req_ovrflw                   : 1;  /**< Instruction FIFO overflow error. This bit is set when the instruction FIFO overflows.
02337                                                          Throws DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_REQ_OVRFLW. */
02338     uint64_t req_badlen                   : 1;  /**< Fetch with length zero error. This bit is set when DPI forms an instruction fetch with
02339                                                          length of zero. Throws DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_REQ_BADLEN. */
02340     uint64_t req_badadr                   : 1;  /**< Fetch with bad pointer error. This bit is set when DPI forms an instruction fetch to the
02341                                                          NULL pointer. Throws DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_REQ_BADADR. */
02342     uint64_t dmadbo                       : 8;  /**< Doorbell overflow error. DPI has a 32-bit counter for each request queue's outstanding
02343                                                          doorbell counts. A bit is set when the corresponding doorbell count overflows. Throws
02344                                                          DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_DMADBO(). */
02345     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
02346     uint64_t nfovr                        : 1;  /**< CSR FIFO overflow error. DPI can store up to 16 CSR requests, and the FIFO overflows if
02347                                                          that number is exceeded. Throws DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_NFOVR. */
02348     uint64_t nderr                        : 1;  /**< IOI decode error. This bit is set when the DPI received an IOI transaction on the outbound
02349                                                          bus to the DPI device ID, but the command was not recognized. Throws
02350                                                          DPI_INTSN_E::DPI_INT_NDERR. */
02351 #else
02352     uint64_t nderr                        : 1;
02353     uint64_t nfovr                        : 1;
02354     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
02355     uint64_t dmadbo                       : 8;
02356     uint64_t req_badadr                   : 1;
02357     uint64_t req_badlen                   : 1;
02358     uint64_t req_ovrflw                   : 1;
02359     uint64_t req_undflw                   : 1;
02360     uint64_t req_anull                    : 1;
02361     uint64_t req_inull                    : 1;
02362     uint64_t req_badfil                   : 1;
02363     uint64_t reserved_23_63               : 41;
02364 #endif
02365     } cn73xx;
02366     struct cvmx_dpi_int_reg_cn73xx        cn78xx;
02367     struct cvmx_dpi_int_reg_s             cn78xxp1;
02368     struct cvmx_dpi_int_reg_s             cnf71xx;
02369     struct cvmx_dpi_int_reg_cn73xx        cnf75xx;
02370 };
02371 typedef union cvmx_dpi_int_reg cvmx_dpi_int_reg_t;

02373 /**
02374  * cvmx_dpi_ncb#_cfg
02375  */
02376 union cvmx_dpi_ncbx_cfg {
02377     uint64_t u64;
02378     struct cvmx_dpi_ncbx_cfg_s {
02379 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02380     uint64_t reserved_6_63                : 58;
02381     uint64_t molr                         : 6;  /**< Max outstanding load requests. Limits the number of outstanding load requests on the I/O
02382                                                          Interconnect. This value can range from 1 to 32. Setting a value of 0 halts all read
02383                                                          traffic to the I/O Interconnect. There are no restrictions on when this value can be
02384                                                          changed. */
02385 #else

02387     uint64_t reserved_6_63                : 58;
02388 #endif
02389     } s;

02403 /**
02404  * cvmx_dpi_ncb_ctl
02405  *
02406  * This register chooses which NCB interface DPI uses for L2/DRAM reads/writes.
02407  *
02408  */
02409 union cvmx_dpi_ncb_ctl {
02410     uint64_t u64;
02411     struct cvmx_dpi_ncb_ctl_s {
02412 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02413     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
02414     uint64_t ncbsel_prt_xor_dis           : 1;  /**< When set, prevents DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[FPORT,LPORT] from determining the IOI/NCB
02415                                                          DPI uses to process instructions. See [NCBSEL_SRC], [NCBSEL_DST], and
02416                                                          DPI_SLI_PRT()_CFG[NCBSEL]. */
02417     uint64_t reserved_21_23               : 3;
02418     uint64_t ncbsel_zbw                   : 1;  /**< Selects the IOBI/NCBI bus DPI uses for byte status writes by any DPI_HDR_PT_E::ZBW_CA,
02419                                                          DPI_HDR_PT_E::ZBW_NC, or DPI_HDR_PT_E::WQP DPI DMA instructions.
02420                                                          0 = DPI uses IOBI2/NCBI2 for all byte status writes.
02421                                                          1 = DPI uses IOBI3/NCBI3 for all byte status writes. */
02422     uint64_t reserved_17_19               : 3;
02423     uint64_t ncbsel_req                   : 1;  /**< Selects the IOB/NCB bus DPI uses for fetching the DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S's,
02424                                                          the first pointers, and the last pointers. DPI does not read the source data of
02425                                                          the DPI DMA instruction via [NCBSEL_REQ] - see DPI_SLI_PRT()_CFG[NCBSEL] and
02426                                                          [NCBSEL_SRC].
02427                                                          0 = DPI uses IOBI2/IOBO2 (aka NCBI2/NCBO2) for all DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S and pointer reads.
02428                                                          1 = DPI uses IOBI3/IOBO3 (aka NCBI3/NCBO3) for all DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S and pointer reads. */
02429     uint64_t reserved_13_15               : 3;
02430     uint64_t ncbsel_dst                   : 1;  /**< The default IOI/NCB that DPI uses for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INTERNAL_ONLY L2/DRAM data
02431                                                          writes.
02432                                                          In the normal case (DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_PRT_XOR_DIS] clear),
02433                                                             [NCBSEL_DST] XOR DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[LPORT<0>]
02434                                                          determines the IOI/NCB that DPI uses for writes.
02435                                                          0 = DPI uses IOBI2/IOBO2 (aka NCBI2/NCBO2) for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INTERNAL_ONLY
02436                                                              DPI DMA instruction L2/DRAM writes.
02437                                                          1 = DPI uses IOBI3/IOBO3 (aka NCBI3/NCBO3) for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INTERNAL_ONLY
02438                                                              DPI DMA instruction L2/DRAM writes.
02439                                                          If DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_PRT_XOR_DIS] is set, [NCBSEL_DST] solely determines the IOI/NCB.
02440                                                          The DPI_SLI_PRT()_CFG[NCBSEL] selected by DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[LPORT]
02441                                                          is the equivalent of [NCBSEL_DST] for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INBOUND DPI DMA instructions.
02442                                                          (DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[FPORT<0>] is used with DPI_SLI_PRT()_CFG[NCBSEL]
02443                                                          for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INBOUND, not DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[LPORT<0>].) */
02444     uint64_t reserved_9_11                : 3;
02445     uint64_t ncbsel_src                   : 1;  /**< The default IOI/NCB that DPI uses for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INTERNAL_ONLY L2/DRAM data
02446                                                          reads.
02447                                                          In the normal case (DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_PRT_XOR_DIS] clear),
02448                                                             [NCBSEL_SRC] XOR DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[FPORT<0>]
02449                                                          determines the IOI/NCB that DPI uses.
02450                                                          0 = DPI uses IOBI2/IOBO2 (aka NCBI2/NCBO2) for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INTERNAL_ONLY
02451                                                              DPI DMA instruction L2/DRAM data reads.
02452                                                          1 = DPI uses IOBI3/IOBO3 (aka NCBI3/NCBO3) for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INTERNAL_ONLY
02453                                                              DPI DMA instruction L2/DRAM data reads.
02454                                                          If DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_PRT_XOR_DIS] is set, [NCBSEL_SRC] solely determines the IOI/NCB.
02455                                                          Note that DPI uses [NCBSEL_REQ] for DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S and pointer IOI/NCB
02456                                                          reads, not [NCBSEL_SRC] nor DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[FPORT<0>].
02457                                                          The DPI_SLI_PRT()_CFG[NCBSEL] selected by DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[LPORT] is
02458                                                          the equivalent of [NCBSEL_SRC] for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::OUTBOUND DPI DMA instructions. */
02459     uint64_t reserved_1_7                 : 7;
02460     uint64_t prt                          : 1;  /**< Directs traffic to the specified NCB unit. (Pass 1 only) */
02461 #else
02462     uint64_t prt                          : 1;
02463     uint64_t reserved_1_7                 : 7;
02464     uint64_t ncbsel_src                   : 1;
02465     uint64_t reserved_9_11                : 3;
02466     uint64_t ncbsel_dst                   : 1;
02467     uint64_t reserved_13_15               : 3;
02468     uint64_t ncbsel_req                   : 1;
02469     uint64_t reserved_17_19               : 3;
02470     uint64_t ncbsel_zbw                   : 1;
02471     uint64_t reserved_21_23               : 3;
02472     uint64_t ncbsel_prt_xor_dis           : 1;
02473     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
02474 #endif
02475     } s;
02476     struct cvmx_dpi_ncb_ctl_cn73xx {
02477 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02478     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
02479     uint64_t ncbsel_prt_xor_dis           : 1;  /**< When set, prevents DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[FPORT,LPORT] from determining the IOI/NCB
02480                                                          DPI uses to process instructions. See [NCBSEL_SRC], [NCBSEL_DST], and
02481                                                          DPI_SLI_PRT()_CFG[NCBSEL]. */
02482     uint64_t reserved_21_23               : 3;
02483     uint64_t ncbsel_zbw                   : 1;  /**< Selects the IOBI/NCBI bus DPI uses for byte status writes by any DPI_HDR_PT_E::ZBW_CA,
02484                                                          DPI_HDR_PT_E::ZBW_NC, or DPI_HDR_PT_E::WQP DPI DMA instructions.
02485                                                          0 = DPI uses IOBI2/NCBI2 for all byte status writes.
02486                                                          1 = DPI uses IOBI3/NCBI3 for all byte status writes. */
02487     uint64_t reserved_17_19               : 3;
02488     uint64_t ncbsel_req                   : 1;  /**< Selects the IOB/NCB bus DPI uses for fetching the DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S's,
02489                                                          the first pointers, and the last pointers. DPI does not read the source data of
02490                                                          the DPI DMA instruction via [NCBSEL_REQ] - see DPI_SLI_PRT()_CFG[NCBSEL] and
02491                                                          [NCBSEL_SRC].
02492                                                          0 = DPI uses IOBI2/IOBO2 (aka NCBI2/NCBO2) for all DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S and pointer reads.
02493                                                          1 = DPI uses IOBI3/IOBO3 (aka NCBI3/NCBO3) for all DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S and pointer reads. */
02494     uint64_t reserved_13_15               : 3;
02495     uint64_t ncbsel_dst                   : 1;  /**< The default IOI/NCB that DPI uses for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INTERNAL_ONLY L2/DRAM data
02496                                                          writes.
02497                                                          In the normal case (DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_PRT_XOR_DIS] clear),
02498                                                             [NCBSEL_DST] XOR DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[LPORT<0>]
02499                                                          determines the IOI/NCB that DPI uses for writes.
02500                                                          0 = DPI uses IOBI2/IOBO2 (aka NCBI2/NCBO2) for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INTERNAL_ONLY
02501                                                              DPI DMA instruction L2/DRAM writes.
02502                                                          1 = DPI uses IOBI3/IOBO3 (aka NCBI3/NCBO3) for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INTERNAL_ONLY
02503                                                              DPI DMA instruction L2/DRAM writes.
02504                                                          If DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_PRT_XOR_DIS] is set, [NCBSEL_DST] solely determines the IOI/NCB.
02505                                                          The DPI_SLI_PRT()_CFG[NCBSEL] selected by DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[LPORT]
02506                                                          is the equivalent of [NCBSEL_DST] for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INBOUND DPI DMA instructions.
02507                                                          (DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[FPORT<0>] is used with DPI_SLI_PRT()_CFG[NCBSEL]
02508                                                          for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INBOUND, not DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[LPORT<0>].) */
02509     uint64_t reserved_9_11                : 3;
02510     uint64_t ncbsel_src                   : 1;  /**< The default IOI/NCB that DPI uses for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INTERNAL_ONLY L2/DRAM data
02511                                                          reads.
02512                                                          In the normal case (DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_PRT_XOR_DIS] clear),
02513                                                             [NCBSEL_SRC] XOR DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[FPORT<0>]
02514                                                          determines the IOI/NCB that DPI uses.
02515                                                          0 = DPI uses IOBI2/IOBO2 (aka NCBI2/NCBO2) for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INTERNAL_ONLY
02516                                                              DPI DMA instruction L2/DRAM data reads.
02517                                                          1 = DPI uses IOBI3/IOBO3 (aka NCBI3/NCBO3) for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INTERNAL_ONLY
02518                                                              DPI DMA instruction L2/DRAM data reads.
02519                                                          If DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_PRT_XOR_DIS] is set, [NCBSEL_SRC] solely determines the IOI/NCB.
02520                                                          Note that DPI uses [NCBSEL_REQ] for DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S and pointer IOI/NCB
02521                                                          reads, not [NCBSEL_SRC] nor DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[FPORT<0>].
02522                                                          The DPI_SLI_PRT()_CFG[NCBSEL] selected by DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[LPORT] is
02523                                                          the equivalent of [NCBSEL_SRC] for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::OUTBOUND DPI DMA instructions. */
02524     uint64_t reserved_0_7                 : 8;
02525 #else

02797 
02798 /**
02799  * cvmx_dpi_sli_prt#_cfg
02800  *
02801  * This register configures the max read request size, max payload size, and max number of SLI
02802  * tags in use. Indexed by SLI_PORT_E.
02803  */
02804 union cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_cfg {
02805     uint64_t u64;
02806     struct cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_cfg_s {
02807 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02808     uint64_t reserved_29_63               : 35;
02809     uint64_t ncbsel                       : 1;  /**< The default IOI/NCB that DPI uses for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::OUTBOUND L2/DRAM data
02810                                                          reads and DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INBOUND L2/DRAM writes. DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[LPORT]
02811                                                          selects which DPI_SLI_PRT()_CFG[NCBSEL] is used for a DPI DMA instruction.
02812                                                          In the normal case (DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_PRT_XOR_DIS] clear),
02813                                                          _   [NCBSEL] XOR DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[FPORT<0>]
02814                                                          determines the IOI/NCB that DPI uses.
02815                                                          0 = DPI uses IOBI2/IOBO2 (aka NCBI2/NCBO2) for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::OUTBOUND and
02816                                                              DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INBOUND DPI DMA instructions.
02817                                                          1 = DPI uses IOBI3/IOBO3 (aka NCBI3/NCBO3) for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::OUTBOUND and
02818                                                              DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INBOUND DPI DMA instructions.
02819                                                          If DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_PRT_XOR_DIS] is set, [NCBSEL] solely determines the IOI/NCB.
02820                                                          Note that DPI uses DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_REQ] for reading DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S's
02821                                                          and first/last pointers, not [NCBSEL]. DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_SRC,NCBSEL_DST]
02822                                                          are the equivalent of [NCBSEL] for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INTERNAL_ONLY DPI DMA
02823                                                          instructions.
02824                                                          A typical configuration might be:
02825                                                          _ DPI_SLI_PRT(0)_CFG[NCBSEL]=1.
02826                                                          _ DPI_SLI_PRT(1)_CFG[NCBSEL]=1.
02827                                                          _ DPI_SLI_PRT(2)_CFG[NCBSEL]=0.
02828                                                          _ DPI_SLI_PRT(3)_CFG[NCBSEL]=0. */
02829     uint64_t reserved_25_27               : 3;
02830     uint64_t halt                         : 1;  /**< When set, HALT indicates that the MAC has detected a reset condition. No further
02831                                                          instructions that reference the MAC from any instruction queue will be issued until the
02832                                                          MAC comes out of reset and HALT is cleared in SLI_CTL_PORT()[DIS_PORT]. */
02833     uint64_t qlm_cfg                      : 4;  /**< Read only copy of the QLM CFG.
02834                                                          0 = MAC is PCIe.
02835                                                          1 = MAC is SRIO.
02836                                                          QLM_CFG does not indicate if a port is disabled.  GSER()_CFG can be used for
02837                                                          more complete QLM configuration information. */
02838     uint64_t reserved_17_19               : 3;
02839     uint64_t rd_mode                      : 1;  /**< Read mode.
02840                                                          0 = Exact read mode. The hardware reads on a four-byte granularity. In this mode, the
02841                                                          hardware may break a given read into 3 operations to satisfy DPI rules.
02842                                                          1 = Block mode. The hardware reads more data than requested in order to minimize the
02843                                                          number of operations necessary to complete the operation. The memory region must be memory
02844                                                          like. */
02845     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
02846     uint64_t molr                         : 7;  /**< Maximum outstanding load requests. Limits the number of outstanding load requests on the
02847                                                          port by restricting the number of tags used by the SLI to track load responses. This value
02848                                                          can range from 1 to 64 (maximum of 32 if port not configured for 8 lanes). Setting MOLR
02849                                                          to a value of 0 halts all read traffic to the port. There are no restrictions on when this
02850                                                          value can be changed. */
02851     uint64_t mps_lim                      : 1;  /**< MAC memory space write requests cannot cross the (naturally-aligned) MPS boundary.
02852                                                          When clear, DPI is allowed to issue a MAC memory- space read that crosses the naturally-
02853                                                          aligned boundary of size defined by MPS. (DPI will still only cross the boundary when it
02854                                                          would eliminate a write by doing so.)
02855                                                          When set, DPI will never issue a MAC memory space write that crosses the naturally-aligned
02856                                                          boundary of size defined by MPS.
02857                                                          MPS_LIM must be set when DPI is operating in SRIO mode (QLM_CFG=SRIO). */
02858     uint64_t reserved_5_6                 : 2;
02859     uint64_t mps                          : 1;  /**< Maximum payload size.
02860                                                          0 = 128B.
02861                                                          1 = 256B.
02862                                                          The MPS size must not exceed the size selected by PCIE*_CFG030[MPS] when DPI is
02863                                                          operating in PCIe mode (QLM_CFG=PCIe).
02864                                                          The MPS size must not exceed 256B when DPI is operating in SRIO mode
02865                                                          (QLM_CFG=SRIO). */
02866     uint64_t mrrs_lim                     : 1;  /**< MAC memory space read requests cannot cross the (naturally-aligned) MRRS boundary.
02867                                                          When clear, DPI is allowed to issue a MAC memory-space read that crosses the naturally-
02868                                                          aligned boundary of size defined by MRRS. (DPI will still only cross the boundary when it
02869                                                          would eliminate a read by doing so.)
02870                                                          When set, DPI will never issue a MAC memory space read that crosses the naturally-aligned
02871                                                          boundary of size defined by MRRS.
02872                                                          MRRS_LIM must be set when DPI is operating in SRIO mode (QLM_CFG=SRIO). */
02873     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
02874     uint64_t mrrs                         : 2;  /**< Maximum read-request size.
02875                                                          0x0 = 128B.
02876                                                          0x1 = 256B.
02877                                                          0x2 = 512B.
02878                                                          0x3 = 1024B.
02879                                                          The MRRS size must not exceed the size selected by PCIE*_CFG030[MRRS] when DPI
02880                                                          is operating in PCIe mode (QLM_CFG=PCIe).
02881                                                          The MRRS size must not exceed 256B when DPI is operating in SRIO mode
02882                                                          (QLM_CFG=SRIO). */
02883 #else
02884     uint64_t mrrs                         : 2;
02885     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
02886     uint64_t mrrs_lim                     : 1;
02887     uint64_t mps                          : 1;
02888     uint64_t reserved_5_6                 : 2;
02889     uint64_t mps_lim                      : 1;
02890     uint64_t molr                         : 7;
02891     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
02892     uint64_t rd_mode                      : 1;
02893     uint64_t reserved_17_19               : 3;
02894     uint64_t qlm_cfg                      : 4;
02895     uint64_t halt                         : 1;
02896     uint64_t reserved_25_27               : 3;
02897     uint64_t ncbsel                       : 1;
02898     uint64_t reserved_29_63               : 35;
02899 #endif
02900     } s;
02901     struct cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_cfg_cn61xx {
02902 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02903     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
02904     uint64_t halt                         : 1;  /**< When set, HALT indicates that the MAC has detected
02905                                                          a reset condition. No further instructions that
02906                                                          reference the MAC from any instruction Q will be
02907                                                          issued until the MAC comes out of reset and HALT
02908                                                          is cleared in SLI_CTL_PORTx[DIS_PORT]. */
02909     uint64_t qlm_cfg                      : 4;  /**< QLM_CFG is a function of MIO_QLMx_CFG[QLM_CFG]
02910                                                          QLM_CFG may contain values that are not normally
02911                                                          used for DMA and/or packet operations.
02912                                                          QLM_CFG does not indicate if a port is disabled.
02913                                                          MIO_QLMx_CFG can be used for more complete QLM
02914                                                          configuration information.
02915                                                          0000 = MAC is PCIe 1x4 (QLM) or 1x2 (DLM)
02916                                                          0001 = MAC is PCIe 2x1 (DLM only)
02917                                                          0010 = MAC is SGMII
02918                                                          0011 = MAC is XAUI
02919                                                          all other encodings are RESERVED */
02920     uint64_t reserved_17_19               : 3;
02921     uint64_t rd_mode                      : 1;  /**< Read Mode
02922                                                          0=Exact Read Mode
02923                                                            If the port is a PCIe port, the HW reads on a
02924                                                            4B granularity.  In this mode, the HW may break
02925                                                            a given read into 3 operations to satisify
02926                                                            PCIe rules.
02927                                                            If the port is a SRIO port, the HW follows the
02928                                                            SRIO read rules from the SRIO specification and
02929                                                             only issues 32*n, 16, and 8 byte  operations
02930                                                             on the SRIO bus.
02931                                                          1=Block Mode
02932                                                            The HW will read more data than requested in
02933                                                            order to minimize the number of operations
02934                                                            necessary to complete the operation.
02935                                                            The memory region must be memory like. */
02936     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
02937     uint64_t molr                         : 6;  /**< Max Outstanding Load Requests
02938                                                          Limits the number of oustanding load requests on
02939                                                          the port by restricting the number of tags
02940                                                          used by the SLI to track load responses.  This
02941                                                          value can range from 1 to 32 depending on the MAC
02942                                                          type and number of lanes.
02943                                                          MAC == PCIe:           Max is 32
02944                                                          MAC == sRio / 4 lanes: Max is 32
02945                                                          MAC == sRio / 2 lanes: Max is 16
02946                                                          MAC == sRio / 1 lane:  Max is  8
02947                                                          Reset value is computed based on the MAC config.
02948                                                          Setting MOLR to a value of 0 will halt all read
02949                                                          traffic to the port.  There are no restrictions
02950                                                          on when this value can be changed. */
02951     uint64_t mps_lim                      : 1;  /**< MAC memory space write requests cannot cross the
02952                                                          (naturally-aligned) MPS boundary.
02953                                                          When clear, DPI is allowed to issue a MAC memory
02954                                                          space read that crosses the naturally-aligned
02955                                                          boundary of size defined by MPS. (DPI will still
02956                                                          only cross the boundary when it would eliminate a
02957                                                          write by doing so.)
02958                                                          When set, DPI will never issue a MAC memory space
02959                                                          write that crosses the naturally-aligned boundary
02960                                                          of size defined by MPS. */
02961     uint64_t reserved_5_6                 : 2;
02962     uint64_t mps                          : 1;  /**< Max Payload Size
02963                                                                  0 = 128B
02964                                                                  1 = 256B
02965                                                          For PCIe MACs, this MPS size must not exceed
02966                                                                the size selected by PCIE*_CFG030[MPS].
02967                                                          For sRIO MACs, all MPS values are allowed. */
02968     uint64_t mrrs_lim                     : 1;  /**< MAC memory space read requests cannot cross the
02969                                                          (naturally-aligned) MRRS boundary.
02970                                                          When clear, DPI is allowed to issue a MAC memory
02971                                                          space read that crosses the naturally-aligned
02972                                                          boundary of size defined by MRRS. (DPI will still
02973                                                          only cross the boundary when it would eliminate a
02974                                                          read by doing so.)
02975                                                          When set, DPI will never issue a MAC memory space
02976                                                          read that crosses the naturally-aligned boundary
02977                                                          of size defined by MRRS. */
02978     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
02979     uint64_t mrrs                         : 2;  /**< Max Read Request Size
02980                                                                  0 = 128B
02981                                                                  1 = 256B
02982                                                                  2 = 512B
02983                                                                  3 = 1024B
02984                                                          For PCIe MACs, this MRRS size must not exceed
02985                                                                the size selected by PCIE*_CFG030[MRRS].
02986                                                          For sRIO MACs, this MRRS size must be <= 256B. */
02987 #else
02988     uint64_t mrrs                         : 2;
02989     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
02990     uint64_t mrrs_lim                     : 1;
02991     uint64_t mps                          : 1;
02992     uint64_t reserved_5_6                 : 2;
02993     uint64_t mps_lim                      : 1;
02994     uint64_t molr                         : 6;
02995     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
02996     uint64_t rd_mode                      : 1;
02997     uint64_t reserved_17_19               : 3;
02998     uint64_t qlm_cfg                      : 4;
02999     uint64_t halt                         : 1;
03000     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
03001 #endif
03002     } cn61xx;
03003     struct cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_cfg_cn63xx {
03004 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03005     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
03006     uint64_t halt                         : 1;  /**< When set, HALT indicates that the MAC has detected
03007                                                          a reset condition. No further instructions that
03008                                                          reference the MAC from any instruction Q will be
03009                                                          issued until the MAC comes out of reset and HALT
03010                                                          is cleared in SLI_CTL_PORTx[DIS_PORT]. */
03011     uint64_t reserved_21_23               : 3;
03012     uint64_t qlm_cfg                      : 1;  /**< Read only copy of the QLM CFG pin
03013                                                          Since QLM_CFG is simply a copy of the QLM CFG
03014                                                          pins, it may reflect values that are not normal
03015                                                          for DMA or packet operations. QLM_CFG does not
03016                                                          indicate if a port is disabled.
03017                                                          0= MAC is PCIe
03018                                                          1= MAC is SRIO */
03019     uint64_t reserved_17_19               : 3;
03020     uint64_t rd_mode                      : 1;  /**< Read Mode
03021                                                          0=Exact Read Mode
03022                                                            If the port is a PCIe port, the HW reads on a
03023                                                            4B granularity.  In this mode, the HW may break
03024                                                            a given read into 3 operations to satisify
03025                                                            PCIe rules.
03026                                                            If the port is a SRIO port, the HW follows the
03027                                                            SRIO read rules from the SRIO specification and
03028                                                             only issues 32*n, 16, and 8 byte  operations
03029                                                             on the SRIO bus.
03030                                                          1=Block Mode
03031                                                            The HW will read more data than requested in
03032                                                            order to minimize the number of operations
03033                                                            necessary to complete the operation.
03034                                                            The memory region must be memory like. */
03035     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
03036     uint64_t molr                         : 6;  /**< Max Outstanding Load Requests
03037                                                          Limits the number of oustanding load requests on
03038                                                          the port by restricting the number of tags
03039                                                          used by the SLI to track load responses.  This
03040                                                          value can range from 1 to 32. Setting a value of
03041                                                          0 will halt all read traffic to the port.  There
03042                                                          are no restrictions on when this value
03043                                                          can be changed. */
03044     uint64_t mps_lim                      : 1;  /**< MAC memory space write requests cannot cross the
03045                                                          (naturally-aligned) MPS boundary.
03046                                                          When clear, DPI is allowed to issue a MAC memory
03047                                                          space read that crosses the naturally-aligned
03048                                                          boundary of size defined by MPS. (DPI will still
03049                                                          only cross the boundary when it would eliminate a
03050                                                          write by doing so.)
03051                                                          When set, DPI will never issue a MAC memory space
03052                                                          write that crosses the naturally-aligned boundary
03053                                                          of size defined by MPS. */
03054     uint64_t reserved_5_6                 : 2;
03055     uint64_t mps                          : 1;  /**< Max Payload Size
03056                                                                  0 = 128B
03057                                                                  1 = 256B
03058                                                          For PCIe MACs, this MPS size must not exceed
03059                                                                the size selected by PCIE*_CFG030[MPS].
03060                                                          For sRIO MACs, all MPS values are allowed. */
03061     uint64_t mrrs_lim                     : 1;  /**< MAC memory space read requests cannot cross the
03062                                                          (naturally-aligned) MRRS boundary.
03063                                                          When clear, DPI is allowed to issue a MAC memory
03064                                                          space read that crosses the naturally-aligned
03065                                                          boundary of size defined by MRRS. (DPI will still
03066                                                          only cross the boundary when it would eliminate a
03067                                                          read by doing so.)
03068                                                          When set, DPI will never issue a MAC memory space
03069                                                          read that crosses the naturally-aligned boundary
03070                                                          of size defined by MRRS. */
03071     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
03072     uint64_t mrrs                         : 2;  /**< Max Read Request Size
03073                                                                  0 = 128B
03074                                                                  1 = 256B
03075                                                                  2 = 512B
03076                                                                  3 = 1024B
03077                                                          For PCIe MACs, this MRRS size must not exceed
03078                                                                the size selected by PCIE*_CFG030[MRRS].
03079                                                          For sRIO MACs, this MRRS size must be <= 256B. */
03080 #else
03081     uint64_t mrrs                         : 2;
03082     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
03083     uint64_t mrrs_lim                     : 1;
03084     uint64_t mps                          : 1;
03085     uint64_t reserved_5_6                 : 2;
03086     uint64_t mps_lim                      : 1;
03087     uint64_t molr                         : 6;
03088     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
03089     uint64_t rd_mode                      : 1;
03090     uint64_t reserved_17_19               : 3;
03091     uint64_t qlm_cfg                      : 1;
03092     uint64_t reserved_21_23               : 3;
03093     uint64_t halt                         : 1;
03094     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
03095 #endif
03096     } cn63xx;
03097     struct cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_cfg_cn63xx   cn63xxp1;
03098     struct cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_cfg_cn61xx   cn66xx;
03099     struct cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_cfg_cn63xx   cn68xx;
03100     struct cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_cfg_cn63xx   cn68xxp1;
03101     struct cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_cfg_cn70xx {
03102 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03103     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
03104     uint64_t halt                         : 1;  /**< When set, HALT indicates that the MAC has detected
03105                                                          a reset condition. No further instructions that
03106                                                          reference the MAC from any instruction Q will be
03107                                                          issued until the MAC comes out of reset and HALT
03108                                                          is cleared in SLI_CTL_PORTx[DIS_PORT]. */
03109     uint64_t reserved_17_23               : 7;
03110     uint64_t rd_mode                      : 1;  /**< Read Mode
03111                                                          0=Exact Read Mode
03112                                                          If the port is a PCIe port, the HW reads on a
03113                                                          4B granularity.  In this mode, the HW may break
03114                                                          a given read into 3 operations to satisify
03115                                                          PCIe rules. */
03116     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
03117     uint64_t molr                         : 6;  /**< Max Outstanding Load Requests
03118                                                          Limits the number of oustanding load requests on
03119                                                          the port by restricting the number of tags
03120                                                          used by the SLI to track load responses.  This
03121                                                          value can range from 1 to 32 depending on the MAC
03122                                                          type and number of lanes.
03123                                                          MAC == PCIe / 4 lanes: Max is 32
03124                                                          MAC == PCIe / 2 lanes: Max is 16
03125                                                          MAC == PCIe / 1 lane:  Max is  8
03126                                                          Reset value is computed based on the MAC config.
03127                                                          Setting MOLR to a value of 0 will halt all read
03128                                                          traffic to the port.  There are no restrictions
03129                                                          on when this value can be changed. */
03130     uint64_t mps_lim                      : 1;  /**< MAC memory space write requests cannot cross the
03131                                                          (naturally-aligned) MPS boundary.
03132                                                          When clear, DPI is allowed to issue a MAC memory
03133                                                          space read that crosses the naturally-aligned
03134                                                          boundary of size defined by MPS. (DPI will still
03135                                                          only cross the boundary when it would eliminate a
03136                                                          write by doing so.)
03137                                                          When set, DPI will never issue a MAC memory space
03138                                                          write that crosses the naturally-aligned boundary
03139                                                          of size defined by MPS. */
03140     uint64_t reserved_5_6                 : 2;
03141     uint64_t mps                          : 1;  /**< Max Payload Size
03142                                                          0 = 128B
03143                                                          1 = 256B
03144                                                          For PCIe MACs, this MPS size must not exceed
03145                                                          the size selected by PCIE*_CFG030[MPS]. */
03146     uint64_t mrrs_lim                     : 1;  /**< MAC memory space read requests cannot cross the
03147                                                          (naturally-aligned) MRRS boundary.
03148                                                          When clear, DPI is allowed to issue a MAC memory
03149                                                          space read that crosses the naturally-aligned
03150                                                          boundary of size defined by MRRS. (DPI will still
03151                                                          only cross the boundary when it would eliminate a
03152                                                          read by doing so.)
03153                                                          When set, DPI will never issue a MAC memory space
03154                                                          read that crosses the naturally-aligned boundary
03155                                                          of size defined by MRRS. */
03156     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
03157     uint64_t mrrs                         : 2;  /**< Max Read Request Size
03158                                                          0 = 128B
03159                                                          1 = 256B
03160                                                          2 = 512B
03161                                                          3 = 1024B
03162                                                          For PCIe MACs, this MRRS size must not exceed
03163                                                          the size selected by PCIE*_CFG030[MRRS]. */
03164 #else
03165     uint64_t mrrs                         : 2;
03166     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
03167     uint64_t mrrs_lim                     : 1;
03168     uint64_t mps                          : 1;
03169     uint64_t reserved_5_6                 : 2;
03170     uint64_t mps_lim                      : 1;
03171     uint64_t molr                         : 6;
03172     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
03173     uint64_t rd_mode                      : 1;
03174     uint64_t reserved_17_23               : 7;
03175     uint64_t halt                         : 1;
03176     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
03177 #endif
03178     } cn70xx;
03179     struct cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_cfg_cn70xx   cn70xxp1;
03180     struct cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_cfg_cn73xx {
03181 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03182     uint64_t reserved_29_63               : 35;
03183     uint64_t ncbsel                       : 1;  /**< The default IOI/NCB that DPI uses for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::OUTBOUND L2/DRAM data
03184                                                          reads and DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INBOUND L2/DRAM writes. DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[LPORT]
03185                                                          selects which DPI_SLI_PRT()_CFG[NCBSEL] is used for a DPI DMA instruction.
03186                                                          In the normal case (DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_PRT_XOR_DIS] clear),
03187                                                          _   [NCBSEL] XOR DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S[FPORT<0>]
03188                                                          determines the IOI/NCB that DPI uses.
03189                                                          0 = DPI uses IOBI2/IOBO2 (aka NCBI2/NCBO2) for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::OUTBOUND and
03190                                                              DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INBOUND DPI DMA instructions.
03191                                                          1 = DPI uses IOBI3/IOBO3 (aka NCBI3/NCBO3) for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::OUTBOUND and
03192                                                              DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INBOUND DPI DMA instructions.
03193                                                          If DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_PRT_XOR_DIS] is set, [NCBSEL] solely determines the IOI/NCB.
03194                                                          Note that DPI uses DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_REQ] for reading DPI_DMA_INSTR_HDR_S's
03195                                                          and first/last pointers, not [NCBSEL]. DPI_NCB_CTL[NCBSEL_SRC,NCBSEL_DST]
03196                                                          are the equivalent of [NCBSEL] for DPI_HDR_XTYPE_E::INTERNAL_ONLY DPI DMA
03197                                                          instructions.
03198                                                          A typical configuration might be:
03199                                                          _ DPI_SLI_PRT(0)_CFG[NCBSEL]=1.
03200                                                          _ DPI_SLI_PRT(1)_CFG[NCBSEL]=1.
03201                                                          _ DPI_SLI_PRT(2)_CFG[NCBSEL]=0.
03202                                                          _ DPI_SLI_PRT(3)_CFG[NCBSEL]=0. */
03203     uint64_t reserved_25_27               : 3;
03204     uint64_t halt                         : 1;  /**< When set, HALT indicates that the MAC has detected a reset condition. No further
03205                                                          instructions that reference the MAC from any instruction queue will be issued until the
03206                                                          MAC comes out of reset and HALT is cleared in SLI_CTL_PORT()[DIS_PORT]. */
03207     uint64_t reserved_21_23               : 3;
03208     uint64_t qlm_cfg                      : 1;  /**< Read only copy of the QLM CFG pin.
03209                                                          0 = MAC is DPI.
03210                                                          1 = Reserved.
03211                                                          Since QLM_CFG is simply a copy of the QLM CFG pins, it could reflect values that are not
03212                                                          normal for DMA or packet operations. QLM_CFG does not indicate if a port is disabled.
03213                                                          GSER()_CFG can be used for more complete QLM configuration information. */
03214     uint64_t reserved_17_19               : 3;
03215     uint64_t rd_mode                      : 1;  /**< Read mode.
03216                                                          0 = Exact read mode. The hardware reads on a four-byte granularity. In this mode, the
03217                                                          hardware may break a given read into 3 operations to satisfy DPI rules.
03218                                                          1 = Block mode. The hardware reads more data than requested in order to minimize the
03219                                                          number of operations necessary to complete the operation. The memory region must be memory
03220                                                          like. */
03221     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
03222     uint64_t molr                         : 7;  /**< Maximum outstanding load requests. Limits the number of outstanding load requests on the
03223                                                          port by restricting the number of tags used by the SLI to track load responses. This value
03224                                                          can range from 1 to 64 (maximum of 32 if port not configured for 8 lanes). Setting MOLR
03225                                                          to a value of 0 halts all read traffic to the port. There are no restrictions on when this
03226                                                          value can be changed. */
03227     uint64_t mps_lim                      : 1;  /**< MAC memory space write requests cannot cross the (naturally-aligned) MPS boundary.
03228                                                          When clear, DPI is allowed to issue a MAC memory- space read that crosses the naturally-
03229                                                          aligned boundary of size defined by MPS. (DPI will still only cross the boundary when it
03230                                                          would eliminate a write by doing so.)
03231                                                          When set, DPI will never issue a MAC memory space write that crosses the naturally-aligned
03232                                                          boundary of size defined by MPS. */
03233     uint64_t reserved_5_6                 : 2;
03234     uint64_t mps                          : 1;  /**< Maximum payload size.
03235                                                          0 = 128B.
03236                                                          1 = 256B.
03237                                                          The MPS size must not exceed the size selected by PCIE*_CFG030[MPS]. */
03238     uint64_t mrrs_lim                     : 1;  /**< MAC memory space read requests cannot cross the (naturally-aligned) MRRS boundary.
03239                                                          When clear, DPI is allowed to issue a MAC memory-space read that crosses the naturally-
03240                                                          aligned boundary of size defined by MRRS. (DPI will still only cross the boundary when it
03241                                                          would eliminate a read by doing so.)
03242                                                          When set, DPI will never issue a MAC memory space read that crosses the naturally-aligned
03243                                                          boundary of size defined by MRRS. */
03244     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
03245     uint64_t mrrs                         : 2;  /**< Maximum read-request size.
03246                                                          0x0 = 128B.
03247                                                          0x1 = 256B.
03248                                                          0x2 = 512B.
03249                                                          0x3 = 1024B.
03250                                                          The MRRS size must not exceed the size selected by PCIE*_CFG030[MRRS]. */
03251 #else
03252     uint64_t mrrs                         : 2;
03253     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
03254     uint64_t mrrs_lim                     : 1;
03255     uint64_t mps                          : 1;
03256     uint64_t reserved_5_6                 : 2;
03257     uint64_t mps_lim                      : 1;
03258     uint64_t molr                         : 7;
03259     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
03260     uint64_t rd_mode                      : 1;
03261     uint64_t reserved_17_19               : 3;
03262     uint64_t qlm_cfg                      : 1;
03263     uint64_t reserved_21_23               : 3;
03264     uint64_t halt                         : 1;
03265     uint64_t reserved_25_27               : 3;
03266     uint64_t ncbsel                       : 1;
03267     uint64_t reserved_29_63               : 35;
03268 #endif
03269     } cn73xx;
03270     struct cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_cfg_cn73xx   cn78xx;

03312 /**
03313  * cvmx_dpi_sli_prt#_err_info
03314  *
03315  * This register logs information associated with the reported SLI error response.
03316  * Indexed by SLI_PORT_E.
03317  */
03318 union cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_err_info {
03319     uint64_t u64;
03320     struct cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_err_info_s {
03321 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03322     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
03323     uint64_t lock                         : 1;  /**< DPI_SLI_PRT()_ERR and DPI_SLI_PRT()_ERR_INFO have captured and locked contents.
03324                                                          When CNXXXX first detects an ErrorResponse, the TYPE, REQQ, and ADDR of the error is saved
03325                                                          and an internal lock state is set so the data associated with the initial error is
03326                                                          preserved.
03327                                                          Subsequent ErrorResponses will optionally raise an interrupt, but will not modify the
03328                                                          TYPE, REQQ, or ADDR fields until the internal lock state is cleared.
03329                                                          Software can clear the internal lock state by writing a 1 to the appropriate bit in either
03330                                                          DPI_REQ_ERR_RSP or DPI_PKT_ERR_RSP depending on the TYPE field. Once the internal lock
03331                                                          state is cleared, the next ErrorResponse will set the TYPE, REQQ, and ADDR for the new
03332                                                          transaction. */
03333     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
03334     uint64_t type                         : 1;  /**< Type of transaction that caused the ErrorResponse.
03335                                                          0 = DMA Instruction.
03336                                                          1 = PKT Instruction. */
03337     uint64_t reserved_3_3                 : 1;
03338     uint64_t reqq                         : 3;  /**< Request queue that made the failed load request. */
03339 #else
03340     uint64_t reqq                         : 3;
03341     uint64_t reserved_3_3                 : 1;
03342     uint64_t type                         : 1;
03343     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
03344     uint64_t lock                         : 1;
03345     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
03346 #endif
03347     } s;
03348     struct cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_err_info_s   cn61xx;
03349     struct cvmx_dpi_sli_prtx_err_info_s   cn63xx;

03360     uint64_t reserved_9_15                : 7;
03361     uint64_t lock                         : 1;  /**< DPI_SLI_PRT()_ERR and DPI_SLI_PRT()_ERR_INFO have captured and locked contents.
03362                                                          When CNXXXX first detects an ErrorResponse, the TYPE, REQQ, and ADDR of the error is saved
03363                                                          and an internal lock state is set so the data associated with the initial error is

03373                                                          0 = DMA Instruction.
03374                                                          1 = PKT Instruction. */

03426 /**
03427  * cvmx_dpi_srio_rx_bell#
03428  *
03429  * Reading this register pops an entry off the corresponding SRIO RX doorbell FIFO.
03430  * The chip supports 16 FIFOs per SRIO interface for a total of 32 FIFOs/Registers.
03431  * The MSB of the registers indicates the MAC while the 4 LSBs indicate the FIFO.
03432  * Information on the doorbell allocation can be found in SRIO()_RX_BELL_CTRL.
03433  */
03434 union cvmx_dpi_srio_rx_bellx {
03435     uint64_t u64;
03436     struct cvmx_dpi_srio_rx_bellx_s {
03437 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03438     uint64_t reserved_48_63               : 16;
03439     uint64_t data                         : 16; /**< Information field from received doorbell. */
03440     uint64_t sid                          : 16; /**< Doorbell source device ID <15:0>. */
03441     uint64_t count                        : 8;  /**< RX bell FIFO count.
03442                                                          Count must be > 0x0 for entry to be valid. */
03443     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
03444     uint64_t dest_id                      : 1;  /**< Destination device ID. 0=Primary, 1=Secondary. */
03445     uint64_t id16                         : 1;  /**< Transaction type. 0=use ID[7:0], 1=use ID[15:0]. */
03446     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
03447     uint64_t dpriority                    : 2;  /**< Doorbell priority. */
03448 #else
03449     uint64_t dpriority                    : 2;
03450     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
03451     uint64_t id16                         : 1;
03452     uint64_t dest_id                      : 1;
03453     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
03454     uint64_t count                        : 8;
03455     uint64_t sid                          : 16;
03456     uint64_t data                         : 16;
03457     uint64_t reserved_48_63               : 16;
03458 #endif
03459     } s;
03460     struct cvmx_dpi_srio_rx_bellx_s       cnf75xx;
03461 };
03462 typedef union cvmx_dpi_srio_rx_bellx cvmx_dpi_srio_rx_bellx_t;
03463 
03464 /**
03465  * cvmx_dpi_srio_rx_bell_seq#
03466  *
03467  * This register contains the value of the sequence counter when the doorbell
03468  * was received and a shadow copy of the Bell FIFO Count that can be read without
03469  * emptying the FIFO.  This register must be read prior to corresponding
03470  * DPI_SRIO_RX_BELL register to link the doorbell and sequence number.
03471  *
03472  * Information on the Doorbell Allocation can be found in SRIO()_RX_BELL_CTRL.
03473  */
03474 union cvmx_dpi_srio_rx_bell_seqx {
03475     uint64_t u64;
03476     struct cvmx_dpi_srio_rx_bell_seqx_s {
03477 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03478     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
03479     uint64_t count                        : 8;  /**< FIFO count. */
03480     uint64_t sid                          : 32; /**< Sequence. */
03481 #else
03482     uint64_t sid                          : 32;
03483     uint64_t count                        : 8;
03484     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
03485 #endif
03486     } s;
03487     struct cvmx_dpi_srio_rx_bell_seqx_s   cnf75xx;
03488 };
03489 typedef union cvmx_dpi_srio_rx_bell_seqx cvmx_dpi_srio_rx_bell_seqx_t;
03490 
03491 /**
03492  * cvmx_dpi_swa_q_vmid
03493  *
